last time heard drum solo a new album think drum solo long relegated the realm live album rock god like led zeppelin of overreaching prog bombast from the like of rush well on fuzz debut selftitled album a drum solo appears a little three minute song loose suture surprising the inclusion of a drum solo album released in the fact didnt immediately recoil like many ive long accepted notion of musical aesthetic that decried bombast sake anything fuzz debut could convince a new generation of musician listener that it time to reassess value in modern rock and rollwhile i may overstating case somewhatafter band like queen of the stone age comet on fire wood and the black angel all borrow from classic rock radiotheres still something invigorating about hearing fuzz unabashed instrumental noodling and if anyone make u rethink whats currently fashionable in rock music it probably ty segall the incredibly prolific artist produce own album breakneck speed but also seems content to collaborate whoever is willing to pick an instrument and play the song on fuzz give you the sense that morphed of epic basement jam session but what save song from accusation of excess is the fact that musicianship always serf the song sleigh ride contains a hook that continually whip the song forward to it conclusion and album opener earthen gate evolves from the primordial goo of it opening into a fully formed rock riffperhaps the key to fuzz success is that despite the call back to early s protometal it also doesnt pretend that the last forty year of music hasnt happened with a little tweaking the shortest song on the album preacher could be transformed into a bona fide punk shredder and unlike rock music from the s that looking for bigger and better studio sound fuzz a distinct lofi element in a sense fuzz might best be viewed another variation on the sound of seattle grunge whose member like mudhoney and soundgarden seemed perfectly happy to break barrier classic rock and punk whatever ingredient were used to concoct fuzz curious brew the result undeniably engaging

stated outset recording not presume be one comparable to serafin and calla and the like to compare this recording to older one like serafins would be futile a comparing klemperers st matthew passion to that of john butt rather it is acknowledged the artist and by the accompanying material that the present recording attempt to something novel this opera replicate a closely a possible the force and practice that bellini might intended gone the large force rounded sound quality and voice to project past healthy limit norma written four year after the death of beethoven norma is temporally closer to classical performance practice later showpiece calling for the innovation of boito and verdi for greater pressure the voice required it is time for the work of bellini to be put context which is bartoli and antonini attempt the difference which are reflected this are not only inherent intentionalthis recording wa always bound to open pandora box of operatic politics praising this recording is not mutually exclusive with disrespecting the exalted status of callas it would be like praising new recording of bach keyboard work on harpsichord having to discount musical giant like glenn gould recorded the work on a modern piano rather it is probably useful to take this recording of norma and examine it according to merit after all nothing like it done though notably calla used smaller intimate force for recording of normaorchestra la scintilla provides expert period accompaniment here while critic question the orchestra relatively extreme dynamic a compared to the rounded sound of a modern orchestra this quality is precisely one that that make a baroque classical orchestra distinctive the thinner gut string which produce a clearer line the woodwind which are capable of a clearer more reedy le hollow tone are capable of producing sudden dynamic change that modern instrument not produce it is a quality that in some way compensates for the reduced force not to say the sound is anemic quite the contrary the sound is always full and the baton of antonini la scintilla playing is always dynamic and forwardthrusting the tempo chosen give new insight the compositional quality of the work take for example the last minute or of the overture the ostinato string pulsate over sustained chord played by the woodwind a relatively faster tempo here though not brisk brings the melody in the woodwind and almost mozartian quality to the string which support them in recording that take this section at a much slower pace quality are muddled and the structure is cloudedcecilia bartoli is not calla bartoli doe not presume to be calla bartoli attempt to do honor to the role creator giuditta pasta who by contemporary account of her voice wa probably a strong mezzosoprano in this bartoli doe an amazing and memorable job rank a one of favorite modern norma todate remembering importantly that giuditta pasta wa not maria calla either can argue opera politics over whether or not giuditta pasta wa or wa not a mezzosoprano but on this recording own merit bartoli ha offered u a characterization of norma that is believable angry conflicted remorseful all rolled into one fiendishly difficult rolesumi jo a adalgisa wa wisely chosen the clearness of her voice is a stark contrast to bartolis darker texture a wonderful representation of the younger priestess for the older norma is scorned one of the highpoints in this entire recording is their duet in act ii reminiscent of bartolis performance with natalie dessay in mozart mitridate the clarity and control is good and passage where the two woman sing in third are oftentimes ravishingjohn osborn a pollione is le of a standout than the woman but executes role very well much ha been said of the singer smaller voice osborne all but that wa the point the call for reduced force with the realization of bellini likely performance practice and notice of the appropriate limit for the human voice refer to the liner note in relation to the evolving size of the orchestra wa an essential consideration making this recording rather than a mistake or pretextual justification for shortcomingthere is much to recommend here it is decidedly a different take on an old bel canto classic but it is far from taking huge liberty from bellini intention this recording is one that plea open ear and perhaps those interested in musicology and period performance opera politics aside

decemberists put aside complexity focus tight songwriting stellar arrangement and create barnburner a longplayer come across the sweetest altcountry band the world paying homage to hero peter buck turn calamity song and the water two favorite rem song rox in the box based on the traditional arrangement perfected by the waterboys raggle taggle gypsy and their spring come to spiddal is referenced in the gorgeous june hymn lastly is fight utilizes a tremendous johnny marr guitar line to perfect effect this lends a familiarity to the proceeding use a heavy americana brush to evoke the emptiness of the mythical west complete pedal steel and harmonica and gillian welchs appalachian drawl pull the entire album together adding color and depth behind colins vocal hopefully this signal a new direction the decemberists a tangent deserves attention and exploration brilliant

new york city businessman gilbert kaplan become passionate thoughtful scholar mahler a strong advocate of mahler nd symphony extensive scholarship kaplan and colleague authorative definitive version of the mahler nd symphony replete correction made by the composer literally month his death the liner note kaplan list the correction have made giving u a splendid overview of work kaplan mere musical dilettante instead a skillful persuasive interpreter of mahler nd symphony strongly emphasizes the pastoral quality of the symphony first movement composed year before the rest of the symphony this is the movement one cd the rest of the symphony is on the second cd indeed he succeeds admirably in leading the vienna philharmonic and the vienna singverein in a majestic brilliant performance in which he emphasizes the rich sonic architecture of the score found this a gripping exciting performance a bit restrained compared to leonard bernstein interpretation notably his second recording deutsche grammophon is a recording i would recommend to classical music lover of stripe well a quite familiar with mahler music especially since it is among the bestrecorded recent deutsche grammophon recording i have heard

power window rush filled clever hook and flowing synthisizers and alot cool tune mark spot the last truly great rush album sure rush continue and sure will continue one of favorite band of time but the album going forward will all be flawed one way another coherent and cohessive power window fill with sense of wonder hear it it on album tour i wa afforded the chance to be in the very front row right geddy lee and it wa absolutely fcking awesome here the songsthe big money yet another rush signature song this is excellent big money go around the world geddy bass on here on the previous two album and it is great to listen to missed that the grove created here absolutely rocksgrand design a to b different degree another song neil flex songwriting skill and keep u in awe lyrically stunning alex get a good guitar sound on this album killermanhattan project another personal favorite written obviously the manhattan project to create the nuclear bomb this song is haunting when geddy sings the pilot of enola gay flying of the shockwave on that august day it give me goosebump i love this songmarathon another great song rush pulled out all the stop on writing and recording this album sound is tight and precise the lyric are phenomenal this is rush the height of power excellentterritories often overlooked gem this song is very cool a favorite alex wail here thw whole wide world an endless universe yet we keep looking the eyeglass in reverse tongue in cheek yet very provacative in it message reminds me a little of witch hunt lyrically greatmiddletown dream at first this song seems like it the weak spot on the album but it grows on and you cant help but liking it musically stunning in it subtle nuance superioremotion detector the sound that rush achieved on power window come out on the tune like mystic rhythm and emotion detector where the synths blend with neils drum to create depth there is a soft spot on power window and im very tempted to say that there isnt it would be emotion detector simply the fact that it is missing that everlasting rush hook i sing along to almost every rush song roll the bone and remember the lyric but i couldnt picture sitting there singing emotion detector out of the blue that make sensemystic rhythm a great ending song to the last great rush album everything flow here from the soaring keyboard to neils stacatto drumming brilliant another great rush tuneoverall power window is very strong even the effort of signal and grace under pressure they perfected their sound again and the result is a very tight memorable album every song stand out on it and that is a very hard thing to dodig it

unswered question regard kim past the naked truth ha the answer difficult review to write many reason objectively certain undeniables but cant help subjective this matter ive known kim throughout the metamorphois interestingly enough juxtaposing physical change with her musical growth both parallel and perpendicular altogether kim is much an anomoly a there ha ever been in music and certainly in hiphop could call her the face of hiphop pun intended but shes a woman correlation would never come to pas for many reason kim is always compared to foxy the apparent that theyre both brooklyn hit the scene virtually the time with biggie and jayz and both contributed along with the aforementioned big and jay to the glamorization of hiphop oh and they both could roc the mic ughh both mics however this is end and look at kims journey you would see they couldnt be different where kim started reppin brooklyn hard and lovely asserting female independence in the maledominated rap game on the classic hardcore foxy opted to jump off her career more main stream with sample sample and well produced track kim raw and edgy foxy flowing with precision came a little safe and calculated foxy wa getting paid upwards of g to put her crotch in calvin klein ad and kim wa plotting a way to get in and revamping her style both successful kim gotten more mainstream while foxy ha taken back the street kim became image driven and foxys image became le marketable a kim is in the midst of a bid fox is to the stage to a when she released ill nana before kim gave u hard core so i believe it come to full circle with the naked truth reasserting kim a street conscious while remaining iconic and foxys soon to be released black rose inserting fox back the mainstream market while still repping both her hood in bk and her root in trinidad the naked truth show kims complete growththere are little to no misstep on this one on tnt kim maintains her style and restores her substance it a hard a hardcore but it doesnt need to be it be it far le pop notorious kim and the production is iller than it wa on la bella mafia this album is a chiselled a kims new face and is a must have for any raphiphop fan

although many critic slammed record songssound the this reviewer opinion totallyinvalid assessment would like saying that the stoogesfun house weezers pinkerton filled soundalike songswhich first listening is true a the masteryof the punk or emo style is mastery within one range thatsalso the case with the cleansing within the deathcore genre this isa really compelling brutally uplifting record with just anger orcookiemonster grunting but actual song whose creativity fineconstruction become obvious to openminded and openeared listenersno pity a coward is flatout brilliant probably the ultimate deathcoresong released to date and the track are not far behind gemsof dark brutal but imaginative music mild caveat is that theproduction could a little cleaner to highlight the late mitch luckersincredible pipe and the overall awesome musicianship to better advantage buton the whole a criminally underrated and very cool record rip in metal peacemitch

failure the american dream hollywood teleevangelism irony make the land of the free rich source of lyrical pathos mark knopflers latest another album riding tainted amber wave leading dire strait mark written a caustic pen painting a sardonic vision of america a scarred battlefield sold fallen ideal and twisted romancesailing to philadelphia is a far forgiving album full of grace and a muddled a of contemporary with the low casual rumble of his gravelly voice he sings story of modest individual with great dream and great individual with modest dream even musician are mostly people dont make the headline get the sense he longs to one of these forgotten folk losing his streamofconsciousness voice his language also becomes more prosaic and poignantwhat is is the first song describing the people in drinking den the soldier sleeping in the fortress and the piper standing alone mark recall constant search something else he even includes vaguely in dream of subdued hubris there a lantern in the tower wee willie winkie with a candlestick still writing song in the wee wee hour these virgil scribblings result in some excellently crafted song telling a travelling gospel band a macho rock star himself in a bar a drugaddicts lover and the regret of a racecar driver speeding arizona gasoline alley and finally finding his something else redemption in nazaretheven though the album is guitar driven mark guitar solo are never showy and you still toast bread his restrained lick like a minstrel mark relied on the folk genre to recount the realism of the plain in two song he hinted country music but a usual he expands on the form the song acquire the texture of a wellused oak door

of all the other customersfans have submitted their review in mind next time

first two albumsthe milkeyed menderandys joanna newsom developed probably original sound emerge since the her harpbased folk piercing vocal eccentric lyric on y turned fierce dramatic epic cosmologicalscale topic her third release the epjoanna newsom and the y street bandwas far bad seemed letdown the brilliance her opening two worksafter a long silence joanna newsom reemerged the beginning of with one on one to shirk from ambition newsom time made a triple album with three set of six song this would seem almost suicidal but newsom show posse the ability to make this look reasonably manageable from the opening easy though lighthearted y the song amazingly sparse beautiful and touching and the epic title tune continues the orchestration of y but without steve albinis harsh production is even more lighthearted but amazing sense of innocence one marvel at even one not agree with edenic imagination with fourth track good intention paving company newsom turn back to the pianobased song she occasionally on the milkeyed mender and make it rock gently and beautifully even with bounce and sensuality provenance turn to the slow harpbased ballad style with beautiful woodwind and a delicate narrative that is much darker and more beautiful than the previous song the first disc finish with baby birch a stately harpbased piece with the beauty of a lullaby perhaps a hymn to the tree disguisethis quiet naturedriven beauty continues on the uncharacteristically short opener to the second disc on a good day which actually manages to show that newsoms art lost nothing reduction to a short length but with and me be she turn back to the quiet epic orchestration of earlier song creating a beautifully romantic though not joyful texture she remembers meeting a lover the gentle delicacy continues with in california which is a simple harp piece about a romantic honeymoon that eventually descends into despair accompanied string jackrabbit is even darker especially in it opening line and return to the wideranging almost cosmic y except that it is really soft even in the sad chorus go long is slow and delicate at first near the end unexpected move to the fastest tempo on the whole album a if newsom ha suddenly found some happiness in the process the skill of her playing is amazing occident return to the jazzy piano style of good intention paving company like the majority of this disc much slower even a drum enter it is slight by newsoms standard but still touchingthe third disc open with soft a chalk a delicately jazzy piano piece of almost sly and haunting power that rival the best song on the first disctori amosorrenaissancecould never have made piano music sound this idiosyncratic delicate or change mood unexpectedly the shimmering esmeacute is also a little slight but the orchestrally beautiful autumn and ribbonbows correct this flaw to create delicate love song on which newsoms piercing tone a little subdued on the second disc return in full flowing the opening of kingfisher again extends this delicate tone into some of the most beautiful balladry seen in the music world a long time the orchestration and wintry lyric reminiscent ofwinteror mother russia with the simple percussive sound and the combination of harp and piano work extremely well the later part however is frenetic almost danceable turning to an airy finale closer doe not suffice is a piano piece of a much sparser quality than soft a chalk or good intention paving company it sad tone is a sign of farewell after the epic of romantic adventure throughout have one on meall in this third album show joanna newsom a an artist with not only talent and ambition but also a maturity and delicacy few had suspected it is no more accessible than y but it shimmering beauty and romantic power from the edenic simplicity of the first few song to the resigned tone at the end is undeniable if you take the time to work way inside

distributed by interscope record said hilsons debut certified gold remains a fixture interscope sophomore effortno boy allowed boy alloweds title is certain offputting making the listener question change that are le song cowritten by keri and le cut contributed by producer timbaland this could perceived positively to extent it make this sophomore album sound le captivating or magical the first there are some solid cut there are also some clumsier one which absent hilsons exceptional debut effortbuyou featuring upandcoming rapper j cole is solid though nearly captivating a the pulsating turning on from her debut produced by polow da the production work by boida is great and the hook albeit it corny is catchy pretty girl rock the current single from this effort impacting the chart is one of the nice change of pace moment from hilsons debut written by neyo and chuck harmony and using a clever interpolation of the two of u pretty girl rock is a clearcut winner with a fine vocal performance and catchy chorus putting the cut overthetop eye on me walk inno question that this girl a tendont hate me cause im beautiful dont hate me cause im beautifulmy walk talk the way i dressits not my fault please dont tripdont hate me cause im beautiful dont hate me cause im beautiful the pretty girl rockthe way love me featuring rick ross feature solid production work but come a keri trying hard hilson sound incredibly manic which is something listener never heard on her debut she possessed swagger without ever sounding to hard on a perfect world bahm bahm do it againi want you is one of the album biggest miss with the polow da don reggaestyled bit somewhat of ill match hilson the laziness of the track it reggaephase grows old quickly while the switch to i want you is odd though wane some of the predictability of the cut one night stand featuring chris brown atones for bahm bahm though the lyricism of this cut is shallow a one night stand is all i need just you and me which degrades some of the credibility of the cut that said the harmonized vocal on the chorus by hilson and brown work extraordinarily well and the chemistry the two is superblose controllet me featuring nelly is a solid cut contributed by stargate hilson sound phenomenal here vocally particularly when she exploit the upper extreme of her voice nellys rap is strong save for anus reference which is completely clumsy and utterly ridiculous toy soldier produced by danja nate hill is well produced with a relatively catchy hook said that i would never to fight againhe said that i would never have to cry the problem is that it is not quite a hit or quite the standout record one would hope for breaking point produced by timbaland feature great production work and is overall solid though it feel the slightest bit undercooked keri sound great here and the background vocal arrangement is superbbeautiful mistake is not a beautiful mistake but rather just a mistake merely average herbie hancock released headhunter album represented change in music his previous album still influence in jazz rb becoming increasingly challenging affair while album fat albert rotunda snappy horn line and memorable melody release crossing and sextant tested the jazz audience patience song length were becoming increasingly long and lacked the memorable theme fat albert rotunda a well a his hard bop recording maiden voyage and emperyean isle herbie simplified his approach cutting his band seven five member made the music funkier while continuing to experiment electronics and importantly put emphasis groove the result one of the best jazz recording released and arguably his best solo album in year recording careerthe album start with chameleon perhaps the best song of the funkjazz genre beginning with a simple synth bass line bennie maupins snappy horn line form the basis of the song herbies synth solo add spacelike sound the next minute the track stop a drum roll from harvey mason lead to paul jackson bass solo first based on a simple funk line get busier a the song continues herbie rejoins the song with a traditional electric piano solo while the band lay down a heavy groove a the song hit minute the playing get busier a the synth return over some kinetic drumming from mason before returning to original theme although the song clock in nearly minute it so exciting seems like a minute song next is a reworked and more laidback version of hancock hard bop classic watermelon man maupins melodic saxophone solo highlight this excellent track sly start a a hard funk ala james brown before becoming a percussion tour de force from mason and bill summer while the chaos ensues maupin throw in a sizzling solo which last over minute then the song stop before going a busy funk workout with hancock entering the spotlight with an awesome piano solo spotlighting his lightning fast technique a the rhythm section gain momentum the song then return to it original theme before it end the last track vein melter is a complete reversal from sly in it presentation led mason march drum beat the band performance is mood maupins playing is a thing of beauty while hancock add soft piano touch and atmospheric synth throughout all told this is one of the best jazz album of all time and a landmark in fusion headhunter a part of every music fan collection

unsure that will like the album and are skittish making the initial investment it a brief overview done mostly for own pleasure expect spoiler everything in it right placethis is actually a typical ascends upwards towards an uneasy apprehensive standoff that somehow reminds of thus spake zarathrustra the listener then encounter the first new element on this album thoms vocal track put a blender then reconstituted into something thats part human part jigsaw puzzle a hackedup bit of sound are dubbed the normal vocal there an odd sense of tension and stasis it the traumatic shock in the defines the song when deep reverbladen synths and muted ish bass drum kick in the effect is something like being transported back to the womb only to find it completely alien the vocal have once been altered this time strained through a distorted vocoder that make sound like a cross an old analog recording and some extraterrestrial along the line of et the song is almost lulling and comforting except for some odd squeak that sound like dissipating air and one single jarringly dissonant sample in the middle carefully calculated to throw the listener hisher guard then a the song sound it innocent and hopeful a sample fade in of a baby cry which in turn crossfades to a single eerie highpitched note this is counterbalanced by a guttural synth sound that lead directly into the next track the national anthemthis is the album begin to sound slightly more like traditional radiohead that is the brass section enters it begin with a simple antagonistic bassline gradually adding drum odd sample ambient noise a highpitched synth and a brief vocal track then of nowhere a low brass rhythym enters eventually rising into squalling trumpet and finally a chorus of different brass instrument playing in different key at different time imagine john coltrane mile davis charles mingus and a number of notable brass soloist blasting away at the same time on respective instrument without any regard for what one another is playing and you begin to get the idea the track is eaten alive by the brass section only to briefly echo in a distorted orchestral arrangement that end on a minor chord setting the stage for the album early climax to disappear completelythose who study radiohead will notice a pattern emerging the fourth track is always a slow haunting ballad which usually wind up being one of the album most powerful track how to disappear completely is the culmination of a number of study in creepily beautiful ballad it begin with almost inaudible string playing an unresolved minor key almost subconsciously setting your teeth on edge gradually an arrhythmic acoustic guitar fade in meandering minor progression which heighten the uneasy mood thom enters quietly in the lower part of falsetto range a heartstopping downward glissando provoke palpitation im not herethis isnt happening sings quietly from the track slowly crescendo by turn achingly beautiful heartrending and nervewracking it equal part crisis and catharsis revelling and worrying over one terrible moment if kid a is a yorke put it something traumatic then this is the definitive moment of trauma all those who accuse kid a of being inhuman listen carefully radiohead have never been more fully committed spiritually and emotionally than in this song treefingersafter the intense ordeal of the last two song the listener is confronted with long rounded synthlike sound actually played on guitar then cutandpasted in postproduction it reminds me of sunlight glinting through the branch of underwater tree kelp or coral i dont know yet even this ambient work so soothing is slightly troubling a well in the end treefingers serf a a fullstop a brief intermission between first and second act a chance for the listener to catch hisher breath optimisticthis track is a somewhat startling jolt the ambient nature of the last one the listener is immediately launched into the most satisfyingly normal song on the album if anything sound like ok computer on kid a this is it specifically it the best part of electioneering rearranged to form an even more biting and sarcastic song try the best you cantry the best you canthe best you can is good enough thom taunt sardonically after commenting on how the big fish eat the little one it the bitter medicine to the everyone is special method of child rearing that ha infected the world today the track is mostly powered by the fivepiece guitardriven dynamic that made radiohead famous although towards the ending it dissolve towards an interesting jam with jazzrock tendency it end with a crash cymbal segueing directly into the next track in limboafter a brief stuttering synth intro tumbling drum and unsettling guitar arpeggio set up a chaotic composition the vocal wailed over these tide of instrumentation only increase the feeling of unease this wa one of the most disturbing song on the album for me between the creepy intonation youre living in a fantasy world reminiscent of the dream on line from the film jacob ladder and the howl of go away that are distorted into meaninglessness at the song end it pretty frightening idiotequecombine a moody ambient synth with stuttering aphex twin beat and challenging vocal and you have the ultimate feelbad antidance electronic track given all that idioteque is still pretty entertaining and surprisingly singabledanceable some bit in it own morbid apocalyptic way one could spend age simply dissecting the intricacy of the squeak and scratch that form the song beat the lyric are mostly oblique although some say that they deal with the threat of global warming the only thing thats really clear is that this song is the foretelling of the inevitable apocalypse that give the album it name kid a is the term for the first child born after an apocalyptic event the track end on a prolonged dissonant chord which dissolve into the next song morning bellif you oversimplified kid a down to just a concept album with the title track representing birth how to disappear completely representing teenage year optimistic being the greedy beginning of adulthood and idioteque being the concerned year of middle age then this song would most likely deal with the central character old age or senility thats not to say that it sound aged or senile it just seems to express the ramblings of a senile mind between the disjointed nonsensical lyric mumbled by yorke in a nervous falsetto whisper the shredded guitar peal in the background and the splintered drum there a general impression of disorder briefly shattered by a sudden crescendo halfway through the song where suddenly all the disparate element of the song seem united in a single purpose only to evaporate back towards minimalist unrest finally fading to just a synth chord and a groping muted bassline motion picture soundtrackkid a grand finale start with just an old organ pumping away at chord that sound older and wiser than time the vocal come slowly patiently heartbreaking in their steady intensity i think youre crazy thom sings in a manner that sound like anything but disapproval there a brief measure of rest then unearthly sound like a child toy or an alien spaceship trickle upwards and downwards over the vocal track eventually supplemented by an equally ethereal operatic voice rising upwards into oblivion to some it may be slightly reminiscent of the soundtrack at the end of the elephant man it drive me to tear almost every time i listen to it the unlikely duet straining upwards towards the heaven a thom sings i will see you in the next life the tinkling jackintheboxlike instrument then slide from the top to the bottom of it range before spiraling off in random tangent slowling fading into silencethis silence last for roughly a minute before it slowly fade into feedback replaced by the sound of string tuning and the lift of an enormous choir collapsing into cheerful electronic beep perhaps this is the next life of which yorke sings if so only glimpse it for thirty second before there are two more minute of silence and the album repeat

lot good album released year none have waited overwhelming mix of anticipation impatience this new release tbm i first heard tbm summer of and ever since i have been looking forward another release i picked violet by mere curiosity i had been listening to a lot of metalgoth like theatre of tragedy tristania sirenia etc and wanted something a little lighthearted yet still somewhat dark and mysterious and exactly i found with tbmthis is tbm third release and stay true to trademark sound this album could called violet volume but this is way a bad thing song this album great and original but the general sound is the it seems in the past couple of year a great deal of favorite band have been releasing new album i go buy it and play it and say is this change their sound for better some for worse but sometimes nice to buy an album expecting to hear a certain sound have fallen in love with and that album delivers it imo tbm need maturing of their sound going in a different direction you have listened to violet and nothing and nowhere you buy this album with confidence in what youd expect to hearwith that said the album start with kill the light the group actually released early this year myspace and their webpage it is a great song and a great sample of what is to come goodnight falling looking glass science walking with stranger and weekend are the more upbeat portion of the album movie remember to die for red star and unfamiliar are the down tempo song to die for my favorite track nothing and nowhere and i wa happy to see it ended up on this album i had heard a rough mix of remember me and this polished up version is greati have tried to find artist similar to tbm but let me spare you the trouble by telling you are none if you love tbm just buy all of their album and that be all you needfavorite track looking glass red star unfamiliar falling down

eine alpensinfonie date time place past a respected composer could literally write orchestral force desired scored for a huge orchestra instrument one countalthough different instrumental part and includes hecklephone windmachine thundermachine tenor tuba and french horn offstage and play measure piece for le one minute it is a veritable bible of orchestrationstrauss is a master of handling huge force surpassed only by gustav mahler and arguably strauss layer of counterpoint and textural conception suffer the hand of overenthusiastic performer insufficiently aware conductor andre previn and the vienna philharmonic prove than capable though and is an absolutely beautiful performance that always brings tear eye following the score listening to this recording demonstrates an astonishing clarity of performance in a complex score and the low brass tone crest a bit occasion it is surely strauss intentionotherwise he would not written two trombone and two tuba on a pedal g fortissimo that passage can not and not played delicatelytrust im a trombonist worthier of note are the fantastic performance by the first trumpet strauss treat almost superhuman the gorgeous horntenor tuba section and the fantastically lush sound overall the performance is not without flaw but the problem are minor indeed and issue of interpretationfor example at the ending previn not observe strauss fermata and the violin never really glissando noticeably strauss indicates to the final interval of a twelfth a compound fifth from f at the top of the treble clef staff to bb the staff is marked glissando is meant is a slide from one note to the next without break and consequentially the f and the note it likely be played on the g string resulting in a dark sound very appropriate for the ending of the piece the ending section is even titled night but the vienna philharmonic or previn or see it otherwise the glissando is inaudible to me is connection the penultimate and the final note and the final phrase is not believe played on the g string at still this is quite a subtle distinction and not one that significantly mar the overall performance of truly deep and powerful musicstrauss criticized for overly programmatic and literal writing trivial music and being derivative of richard wagner and gustav mahler whatever truth criticism hold the fact remains that wagner mahler and strauss revolutionized music aside from already wellknown harmonic innovation and orchestral mastery freed melody from primarily vocal conception limited it from it origin where composer before would follow a large leap motion in the opposite direction thereby restricting the melodic line in musical space these three composed great soaring line in which a large leap might well be followed by another leap or stepwise motion in the direction the resulting theme often surpass the range of a single instrument a given melody might for example begin in the tuba doubled with bassoon celli and contrabass move to french horn and finally end in the upper register of flute oboe and violin orchestration becomes not simply an assigning of instrument to particular line but an inseparable part of the composition of a piece whatever flaw strauss music might have and i have to admit that the storm scene in the alpine symphony with it wind and thunder machine and the portrayal of raindrop in the pizzicato string is cliched for my taste it glory far surpass themit is a bit of a shame that nothing is coupled with the alpine symphonyat only minute this disc is a bit slim and i think that death and transfiguration would have made a stunning companion piece but perhaps previn and vienna have already released a version of that work at any rate even alone this is an excellent performance of a glorious piece and well worth owning

come band van halen may the minority when i say i feel became better band when sammy hagar brought in to replace david lee roth the lead vocalist when it come to showmanship david lee roth would be a tough act to follow however sammy hagar brought something else to the table the allaround quality musicianship it wa that musicianship that elevated van halen to even greater height of creativity it wa that musicianship that could be replaced when gary cherone wa later brought van halen to replace hagar i subscribe to the notion that sometimes the best thing a mature band to bring in outsider to join the band it give the band fresh idea a new perspective i look the case of the rolling stone bringing ron wood in ron wood much play bass became a significant contributor to the band to sammy hagar like not injected new life into the van halen band and became a significant contributor much like wood did for the stone hagar doesnt sing hell contribute to the songwriting and production of the effort of van halen like ron wood sammy hagar already proven to be an accomplished musician album sammy hagar the essential red collection provides great insight into not just sammys pre van halen day sammys entire career outside of van halenone thing that amazes me is that the essential red collection is a single cd of track comprising minute of music certainly going to get value this cd for the part the essential red collection is going to focus on sammys and s solo career it also contains some of the soundtrack work that sammy done are also two unreleased track and a track he did previous band montroseit is also worth noting there are compilation there when considering the essential red collection it probably pay to compare and contrast this ha to offerrematch this wa a greatest hit compilation that wa released in it contain song that are on the essential red collection red ive done everything for you and a live version of montroses bad motor scooter it also contains a lot of hagars s work that is not included on the essential red collection album a nine on a ten scale musical chair and street machine are not represented on the essential red collection but are found on this collectionbest of sammy hagar capital record released in this is another collection that compliment the essential red collection the same three song overlap this collection that overlap rematch red ive done everything for you and bad motor scooter this cover sammys work while with capital record moving to geffen record the big difference this best of and rematch is that best of includes sammys cover of otis redding sittin on the dock of the bay sadly this cover wa omitted the essential red collectionunboxed this collection wa released in and cover sammys work with geffen record there is overlap between unboxed and the two capital record compilation rematch and best of most of the song on unboxed are included on the essential red collection the four song that are not included on the essential red collection are buying way into heaven baby on fire three lock box and i dont need lovedespite many of the song that are in some of older compilation that arent included the essential red collection brings some unique thing it is the sammy hagar compilation that bridge his capital record work with his geffen record work it is the only collection that includes soundtrack work that sammy ha done fast time at ridgemont high title song the girl get around from footloose and the winner take it from the top it includes two unreleased track from the early s thinking of you and call my name it includes three song from his s work little white lie marching to mar and ma tequilaone thing i like is when a greatest hit collection arranges track in chronological order this allows me to see the artist ha progressed over time even though there are some gap in the essential red collection sammys late s work and his van halen day it is still a good thing that the track arranged chronologically this still give some sense of how sammys career ha evolvedmost importantly though the essential red collection truly entertain you of the track doe a great job at showcasing sammys talent this reaffirmed my theory that it wa sammy hagar that took a group like van halen to the next levelthe liner note truly justice to this compilation in addition to the cd packaged in a unique red tinted jewel case there are lot of extra ted nugent writes some introductory word scott schinder writes a terrific biographical sketch of hagar focusing on his solo career finally each of the track are listed with songwriter mostly hagar production credit and most importantly what album each of the song came from overall this is a terrific snapshot of hagars career you arent familiar with his work outside of van halen this is the collection to get you always compliment it with the rematch or best of collection to get some of the earlier work the only negative i can think of his the exclusion of sittin on the dock of the bay otherwise a highly recommended collection

released fine album ambient music orb alex paterson andy hughes thomas fehlmann although critically well received upon release actually enjoy orbus terrarum a great deal and appreciate the soothing and atmospheric aspect of the music in large part is easy put this album and let it melt the background the listener chooses tothe seven track on the album pretty long four track are in the minute range is perfect this type of music in large part the music consists of fizzing and bubbling tone color and sequenced rhythm part generated on bank of synthesizer and electronic device guitar and acoustic instrument are used well including the piano indeed the appearance of the acoustic piano on oxbow lake provides a startling dynamic contrast to the smooth and nearly static ambience of the first two trackssamples and found sound are employed including prerecorded snippet of the human voice on a track the last track slug dub is a good example of this and feature prerecorded and electronically altered voice narrate a tale of troublesome garden pest slug in amongst some quasireggae inflected rhythm it is fairly psychedelic actually and a fine example of ambient dubalthough the piece generally exhibit little variation respect to timbre and melody are delicate and used sparingly the music is not a static a one might expect are enough albeit subtle variation in dynamic the booming lower frequency are great that it make for a reasonably interesting listening experience moreover integral part of the composition yet never insistent the rhythmic element spice thing considerably which may reflect a terry riley influenceall in all this is a fine album of ambient music that is slightly more rhythmically charged other ambient album that i listened to music for airport brian eno and rainbow dome musick steve hillage come to mind in fact a a longtime progressive rock fan looking for newer and interesting music this provided a fun listen and present a nice update on the ambient style

you a billion mile awayquot showing how painful yokos loss really wa the synthesizer that could belong in m ono music is present this time blending in with a beautiful piano part quotlonelinessquot is again not a positive a the album title or theme a a whole describing how yoko quotendure almost anythingquot except for loneliness quottomorrow may never comequot is another favorite with a short simple message on how really dont know happen to u quotyesterday may scar u forevertoday may never foundtomorrow may never comequot i almost see side a a lesson almost like a continuous sequence of of dustquot with bomb dropping a part of the percussion the handclap are again present but this time are virtually instrument playing except for a whistle blowing a couple of note time to time yoko is accompanied with a chorus of background singer with the verse adding to the song beauty the following song is much more positive and relieving called quotdream lovequot this once again is not my rollarcostar of emotion the whole album the positive lyric help ward off bad spirit the darker song created so it leaf you off with a happy notequite obviously i definitely recommend this album a most of her album do this showcase yoko ono great talent in many different field i truly think she is a genius and this album definitely deserves to be in more collection

dark side moon pink floyds eighth studio albumthere never never band quite like pink floyd extensive career the prog rock quartet of dave gilmour guitar roger water bass rick wright keyboard and nick mason drum made a legendary contribution rock music ive also forgotten original frontman syd barratt list the band tried their fair share of new idea and in many way paved the way in pushing the boundary of music of the band album quite popular none more than dark side of the moon heralded the floyds greatest work and one of the greatest album of all time album ha shifted more unit than rock album ever made sale are over million unit think so is this album really deserving of great popularity and also is that bit specialfor is question this is pink floyds ultradefinitive album and also their finest album other hardcore floyd fan may disagree and choose wish the wall preference but i think that this top pink floyd to this point amazingly demonstrated their great potential none more so than in their great release meddle that album you could sense that the band were the brink of producing a true masterpiece and here you have it the ultimate masterpiece the band in dark side of the moon everything come together on this album the song run cohesively and perfectly from one to the next and the songwriting is literally awesome it come a no surprise that all of the band member had songwriting input on the album rather than the sole water dominance that would come in later album and this demonstrates why this album is so good it often amazes me that there are people around today are more than willing to bash this album i constantly hear comment a it sound dated or this music make me fall asleep people probably listener to senseless nu metal emo crap or anything else thats abysmal in music in recent time never fail to amaze me i dont know stuff must be on to make them so diluded last check this album made over year ago yes year people are quick to dis the technique that pink floyd used on this album to make various effect but at the time it wa completely new and revolutionary they didnt have the latest digital recording studio to help them out that aside the various style the band use on the album me still sound fantastic and fresh gilmours guitar work is first rate a are vocal water bass play is beautifully resonant throughout and the keyboard work by wright is fantastic with that all aside it is the lyrical concept that really make this album so good pink floyd take you amazing conceptual journey on this album and one that you never tire of the all realisitic theme of loss of time war madness and death are in this album the band tackle a whole load of theme in this minute album you cant not be emotionally moved by it this is why the album ha appealed to so many over time the album concept driven experimental but ultimately polished and structured style is what make it shine so much the album ha so many side to it and you notice something new with every listen who also could miss the cover the prism effect front is simple but an amazing eyecatcherthe journey of the dark side of the moon begin with opener speak to mebreathe the opening part of the song open up with a showcase of the effect to come mad voice a woman screaming cash till and everything else all cleverly mix together note all the voice you hear on the album were worker at the recording studio who had their reponses recorded they were asked madness this run the start of the proper music firstly with the classic guitar and bass line for the album followed by a couple of verse of harsh and brutal lyric on the run is a clever track with a racing electronic sound which wa created by speeding a note sequence on a tape loop there plenty more effect added in on this track then come to the album first epic in time a surpise entrance of ringing bell kick start this one gilmours crunching guitar chord alongside echoing drumming give this song an atmospheric build up this then becomes a lyrically amazing song with theme on time slipping away and growing old gilmours guitar solo is brilliant a is the breathe reprise song exit following this great track is the closing song for side one with great gig in the sky rick wright gentle piano chord are superbly contrasted by the passionate emotional and evocative wail by singer clair torry who the band hired for the song the song is like nothing ive heard beforethe second half of the album open with the album famous song who could fail to recognise the unique cashmachine sound at the start of the song rhythmically this song is weird a it is written in time a opposed to the standard however this time signature pave the way for the song classic bass line the lyric based around corporate wealth greed and acquisition are classic a is the middle section with plenty of roaring guitar u and them follows perhaps the album most heartfelt song based on the theme of outrage at the continuation of the vietnam war this song is powerful the keyboard work is imaginitive and the saxophone solo is brilliant any colour you like is next this one is experimental gilmour try his hand at some quirky guitar play over some great keyboard dub the madness theme of brain damage is next up which look at the mental damage caused to war casualty this is another foreboding song with a brutal and realistic edge finally to close this epic album is eclipse a short punchy finish with plenty of contrasting lyric building to a climax the heartbeat at the end cleverly trail the album to a finish in the style just like it begandark side of the moon is an epic musical journey through the tragedy of life pink floyd were at their absolute peak with this album and the work is never short of inspired moment this album is perfect everything come together both musically and lyrically plenty of people have this album but still you dont then this is a must buy this album is not just the place to begin a pink floyd collection it is the place to begin a good music collection in general trust me and all the other high rated review for this album this album is well worth the money you will pay for it and the time you will spend listening to it excuse the punsextra note dark side of the moon wa issued in an sacd format some time ago if you have the technology for sacd format then this is the version you may want to get i personally dont know what the quality is like with that version and ive heard a mixture of positive and negative feedback alike about itmy rating a classic that rise the rest

score terrible let postulate onset the review know whether continue reading this score is not terrible the music is necessarily so because written harry potter film is a complete and utter failure ive listened to the album entirety several time and continually perplexed that am hearing heard in the latest potter film it is one of the illfitting score for a franchise ive ever heard even you discount the previous effort williams and doyle of wonderful in noctem is a enjoyable piece of music but the aspect of the cue that root it in fantasy the bell the chorus it simply not work for a potter film period ginny present williams obligatory theme verbatim but seems forced the theme to make appearance at least so it seems hooper shoved it right in creative effort whatsoever ootp wa far light airy and atmospheric considering the source material and that trend perpetuates with hbp the exception malfoys mission which relies to heavily formulaic tension created by string intended for gravitas much of the blame for this rest with yates chose hooper due primarily to a prior relationship and seems to handle the severity of the event which took place in the fifth installment rather lightlyas i stated earlier the music is not awful if only mediocre i prefer this score to the garbage being spewed by remote control lately transformer angel demon etc but the abandonment of what are unequivocally franchise theme and the sheer awkwardness of the instrumentation pacing and tone is simply inexcusable i yet to see the movie but am convinced that it remains inappropriate williams is still capable of producing better music anyone and repeatedly expressed interest in scoring the final installment i sincerely hope williams return or at the very least hooper is replaced by a appropriate talent

guy really know wind music album start to finish startling emotional very unpredictable mean writing review the album le word is a very tricky thing to dobut goesthe thing radiohead is genius experementation in the studio and create of the densley creative soundscapes youre ever likely to hear from album except ok computer the time they love to play like a anthemic u style rock band which they very sucsessfully thanks to the accomplished playing from the member of the group helping to bring the music sharper focus make the album work well though is the way they switch the two and the way keep you interested throughout quotplanet telexquot is a heavily produced echoey song which sound like it made on another planet the music made even distant thom yorkes screaming vocal which painfully break the music quotthe bendsquot though show love of simply rocking without abandon with a powerful chord that charge into the song like a bullet the music stop however see the depressiveness of this album yorke say quotwhere do we go from herequot showing a deep vat of lonliness that feel bringing the song into much closer inspection rocking quothigh and dryquot is a beautiful melodic song with very dark undertone to it quotdont leave high dont leave me dryquot but to hear yourke sing it it seems like more of a love song than anything else but on closer inspection you see what all about quotfake plastic treesquot is and sound like a thorougly depressing song about how life become cheap imitation of what the real thing is showing how empty our life have become and the fact missing the most important thing quotwhees the lovequot a yorke say quotbonesquot is a great song dont know it just is give me a break music isnt that deep really quotnice dreamquot is just that it a song that is beautiful it playing but you cant quite remember it afterwards weird huh quotjustquot is just great it a fantastic rocker that prevents the album from alienating listener much evryone quotrock outquot to this one quotmy iron lungquot is achingly melodic song with an excellent guitar motif at the start which belies the painful lyric that go with it before spiraling downwards into a hard rocking set of power chord in a way radiohead could pull basically without going on too long this becomes the format of the album with the music hopping between ok computer style soundscapes and classic rocker but what always set this music apart from any music from the is the lyric and voice of thom yorke which sound thoroughly depressing yet strangely life affirming i dont know anyone sat down to this album and felt thoroughly depressed it much a message that say quotlife is horrible let all kill ourselvesquot but more a statement saying quotwhat can we do to make our life betterquot i love this album and matter what mood i in i can listen to it and always happy againa masterpiece

okay could argue never left let face it rush the rush from the s onward different band one band progressive rock giant creating spectacular progressive rock album minute masterpiece are undeniable classic the band good even though became one could call a progressive pop band and they made the transition better just peer like band equally but i wa longing a return the s form creating concept piece with the addition of their modern lyrical themeswell get it clockwork angel for the part yes the album fit firmly in the category of progressive rock the time it is also undeniably modern day rush with their modern sound and noise present dont worry loudness war rant i like the noise but it also is a callback to the earlier rush with the entire album a loose concept from beginning to end the concept involves a futuristic society with interstellar travel and a rigid belief system enforced the big brother like watchmaker what i really appreciate about the album though is that almost all the song taken of context and still be enjoyable of rush best track ever are album particularly bub to call back to their early hit like working man a passage to bangkok halo effect is probably the best song on the album lyric wise it reminds me a lot of closer to the heart and i a feeling it become a concert staplethe one complaint i have is that i wish neal gone farther with concept this might have sacrificed some of the commercial appeal of the record i think it would have great to have a true full fledged concept album that told this same story while the song are all great is element of unfinished concept wise the latter half of the album suffers from this somewhat a the song become longer and you realize their telling a story you dont have enough information to fully understandoverall though this is a spectacular release and hopefully indicates a return to rush early form

mid pantera frontman philip anselmo starting dabble in side project started christ inversion in later continued to and superjoint ritual among band christ inversion didnt last long one really expected much phils other project and surely no fan expected down debut to so good down wa clearly onto something with album and didnt become so famous just anselmo fronted the group nola abbreviation new orleans louisiana is good a better anything the band member made even though the member down came from pantera corrosion of conformity crowbar and eyehategod nola sound like mix of pantera and black sabbath with lynyrd skynyrds southern influence this is a bludgeoning album which is overflowing with thick hefty doominfluenced riff solo and crunching rhythm plus phils wailing yell sound perfect the dark meaty sounding music helping to give this album a timeless feel phils vocal style is pretty much the a on pantera record an impressive performance nonetheless vocal couldnt be full of emotion he yell growl howl yelp bellow and song like rehab show he even singcroon a little plus enjoy phil build from a grunt to a scream on track like the sabbathy door opener temptation wing lifer pillar of eternity and hail the leaf which very catchy song with churning guitar the fiery riff on losing the tortured crowbaresque swan song and the punching grinding album closer bury in smoke are some of the standout track on here and good representation of the album a a whole even with mellower moment like the acoustic pray for the locust and jail which is very similar to panteras cover of planet caravan is hardly a weak moment on all of nola pantera fan be cautious checking this album because it typically quite slower and sludgier than anything pantera put and even though could stand to a more fast song youre looking for a very powerful brooding and satisfying metal album put this near the top of list

title chose review i used place this cd take head my heart this terrific solo debut cd jeff endemann whose voice and guitar playing i convinced the world need hear plenty ofits difficult for me to get poetic and track track rundown here is chiefly because i feel that mr endemanns guitar playing and melody are the best ive heard and voice is that of a bard penning and delivering lyric that are le pure poetry for the soulthe serpent speaks to me a middle eastern feel and drip mysticism that that i lovegoodbye to avalon is a tearjerker ive ever heard one and ive heard plenty of in my year this earth ha me in tear i write this a beautiful ode to a lost and mourned way of life in a different and simpler timefalling leaf seems to a song of searching for the self going by the chorus the melody is lovely and though it is a country song it put me in mind of of balladeer cowboy singing from the heart and singing from the heart is a beautiful thingshadows of sherwood forest is another jaunt back to the day of yore exotic percussion guitar and lute or mandolin or perhaps do a happy dance with bardic vocal to put me in mind of ancient troubadour lyrically and melodically this one is a heart wearmer that put a smile on the face and a spring in the stepthe funeral procession of the gypsy queen is a somber march played ancient percussion mournful guitar and voice image of robed figure perhaps druidic come to mind carrying torch a traverse a forest bearing the body of beloved queen to final place of rest music that paint picture in the mind a mr endemann can do is a wonderful thing to experienceshe lie beneath the rose is my favorite on the disk with goodbye to avalon the first i love song that to me hearken back to ancient day and i hear one of right here the guitar melody is a thing of beauty a is mr endemanns delivery of poignant lyric depicting the parting from this world of a beloved soul and perhaps also the passing of an idealwinter is a pleasing warming ode to the coldest of season delivered with a warmth that is felt in the heart for me it paint for me a picture of either a loved one or perhaps the earth hint of the cyclical nature of life and death dance the piece going from to the return of life and back it is a picture that is beautifully paintedso far to me is a perfect piece of road music i dont say that because of tempo but because it put me in mind of someone driving across the country through the open road the evening time watching the sunset moon and starlight a they ponder the human condition image of campfire on beach come to mind lyrically it make me think melodically gripping and vocally it is beautifully deliveredlullaby the sun is slipping is a piece that touch the heart and drift through the soul in a way that thing ive heard done for me the beauty of the guitar and vocal melody make me joyful for those out there are father and call to mind a blessing parenthood is also making me thankful to god for the man gave me to be my earthly father for that i am grateful a the song is a reminder of true blessing and one of the greatest joy a man can ever know on this earthin closing i do believe the world need to hear more of jeff endemann and if havent do a favor and try this if you allow yourself the courage to be touched heart be touched by this release

killing joke always one underrated underappreciated band of the last two decade the collective work of fulllength album and several quotcollectionsquot disc ha never been single u radio hit track quotpandemoniumquot received limited radio play latenight program showcasing nonmainstream music the extent of the fame kill joke plus year domination of the underground music scenebut within killing joke repertoire quotoutside the gatequot probably the biggest hidden gem invisible the popular music world and disregarded even many hardcore kj enthusiast incredible album is in opinion one of best since is rather difficult to find this wa the last kj album added to my collection and boy wa i disappointed that this album ha been around since and i didnt pick it year later heck i wa year old this album wa released but the incredible thing about virtually of kjs music is that it doesnt age all song off their debut still modern moreso a lot of is played heavily on the radio today killing joke set the stage countless band to follow and a a result are the unsung hero deserve the fame many band received instead metallica and nine inch nail come to mindive heard this album referred to a quotdisastrousquot quota disgracequot among other thing to of who think that i ask this you actually listened to the album the only bad track on the album are the sloppy remixes at the end that sound a if the only thing changed wa the addition of some sample the s news the first song are incredible and rank right up there the unforgettable lyrical track of the previous album quotbrighter than a thousand sunsquot every track is excellent beginning with the cynically pridefilled quotamericaquot and culminating in the mystical title track quotoutside the gatequot quotobsessionquot and quottiahuanacoquot are also excellent song though hard to pick one song a a favoritemusically quotoutside the gatequot seems a logical progression in the life of kj quotnight timequot and quot sunsquot practically discarded kjs tribal musical root in favor of a mainstream though still completely unique rock sound this album began the progression back toward the heavier kj of quotextremitiesquot and quotpandemoniumquot a a result the fan of the more venomous kj present in whats this for and revelation might disappointed with this album musical beauty but kj transcended many genre of music throughout their life and this album doesnt seem out of place at all when you look at kj a a wholeto put it simply this album got lost in the shuffle of killing joke and it is album that need to be rediscovered it fairly hard to get ahold of but if you manage i dont think youll be disappointed every single track could have been written last week not in the bighair day of the s killing joke ha withstood the test of time and it my belief that perhaps the world is still waiting to truly discover

profoundly impressed first exposure nightwish via oceanborn next step to immediately procure next three release obviously right wa really curious to hear wishmaster since seems to difference opinion it seems to inspire ambivalence lack of enthusiasm some sometimes seems to grade lower nightwish cdsi reaction i absolutely loved it the start and it probably end time favorite like top my impression well everything i could want in music power beauty passion memorable melody rhythmic drive vibrantpositivelifeaffirming attitude all there to me wishmaster come classic melodic metal it somewhat reminiscent of vintage iron maiden a opposed to the dream theatre type progressive vibe of oceanborn or the heavier more modern flavor of century child and to suggest nightwish derivative without doubt a strong character all of their comparison a rough frame of referencewishmaster is more guitar driven than oceanborn a bit le grandiose and not quite a bold or dramatic it also noticeably more polished there arent really clunky element in the music and sound quality is much better wishmaster doesnt have the harsh highfrequency issue oceanborn really help the listening experience it a balanced sound no one element dominates get a strong impression of cohesion and synergy everyone pulling together id say the vocal benefit from this ive noticed the vocal sometimes get a little lost in the mix other nightwish cd not the case hereand thats a really good thing there is any vocal performance that be highlighted it tarja turunens performance on wishmaster the word i can use is sublime im probably guilty of overusing this adjective it come to nightwish thats the only way i can really sum it up i guess gorgeous and stunning work pretty well but im sticking sublime the vocal are firmly in the classical operatic style really similar to those on oceanborn though i like classical music i never liked classical vocal ive always thought of a stuffy and selfindulgent i dont have that feeling all with tarja in contrast i just cant get enough somewhat sadly nightwish went to a more conventional vocal style following wishmaster though i think tarja is still the best heavy music singer out there even in a more conventional style the unique flavor of performance in wishmaster and oceanborn are unforgettableall this raving about the vocal performance shouldnt overshadow the other performance in wishmaster a usual nightwish is really disciplined in songwriting and arrangement there no self indulgence the song are all memorable there terrific use of melody and harmony and the playing is top notch also a usual i find it impossible to pick favorite my favorite track is whichever one im listening to at the moment i love it when a cd is consistent listen all the way take a quick break repeat repeat againin some way wishmaster isnt super original it more of a unique take on the classic metal formula you could argue that the guitar lead have all been heard operatic vocal are common on pb youve heard those chord change before and so on i think thats true of the vast majority of music out there you could make similar argument for just about any lpcd truly ground breaking effort arent that common wishmaster is not in that category if youre interested in that vibe oceanborn or century child might be better choice if youre really the heavy modern grindy sound or a bit more of a darker vibe once would be a better nightwish choicei think wishmaster will appeal most to people value melody harmony and balance in their music a opposed to those who favor heaviness or sheer guitar drive or are finicky about their metal i think that wishmaster is so strong in area that i would probably pick this a the cd that i would use to expose nonmetal fan to the music i think it transcends the genre or a one of my bros like to say it world class

john debneys score passion the christ curiosity the music paired the film image doesnt overpower manipulate whats happening screen the interesting thing is the score a standalone listen is amazing piece of work dark brooding with moment of enlightenment but enough theme work stand a filler is a classical piece of middle eastern flavor with wonderful moment of chorus that oddly used a background noise or focused meditation good movie score getting harder find especially contemporary filmmaking but debneys is one of the better to come along in awhile highly recommended

anyway neil diamond never among legion devoted worshipper but ive always thing tune sweet caroline though i prefer sinatra bizarre version have a perverse fascination ridiculous poweranthem america have neils much writtenabouthypeddisplayed large quantity major retailer collaboration with producer rick rubin the guy behind the amazing final album of johnny cash the trademark strippeddown quality here mostly acoustic guitar piano and organ occasional quiet string thing neil diamond is johnny cash doesnt have the weight wisdom humanity and sincerity of the somehow instantly classic american recording the whole thing is definitely listenable enough but every so often neil get his overwrought straining dramatic singshouty voice and hear the big orchestra swelling behind but instead you hear strumming guitar and tinkling piano and the song have that certain pompous oversolemn character that i guess diamond become the undisputed master of there nothing here youre going get stuck in head for week like sweet caroline but at the end of the day you have to admire the plodding determination of this stuff and youre in the right kind of hungover a weekday morning andor driving the nebraska prairie sort of mood sound pretty damn good so if you have inclination to buy this rational not go ahead you wont disappointed and if you want to hear it you probably will be buying it apparently the good folk at sony have put every kind of copyprotection imaginable on here to prevent anything maybe dubbing a cassette copy although that might just be the perfect way to listen to this all

liked prior recording venetian music paul mccreesh i bought cd without knowing anything it disappoint like the prior recording by the gabrieli consort this one mixture of beautiful playing singing and scholarship is not pedantic the note helpful setting the scene the doge and the signoria did to celebrate christmas central to paul mccreeshs recreation of christmas eve celebration is the mass by cipriano de rope the maestro di cappelle san marco plain chant mass based upon a six part motet by josquin rope add a seventh part adding to the complexity of the polyphony the dazzling section is the setting jesu mi dulcissime by gabrieli written two choir and organ operatic quality about the musicthe recording is an interesting mix of plain chant and the orchestral and choral music of giovanni gabrieli and recreates the atmosphere of a christmas eve at san marco at a timing of this is a cd loaded music and of interest to anyone interested in venetian music and early polyphony for curious about this period of music i would first recommend mccreeshs earlier a venetian coronation

isnt greatest handel aria cd really dont know look the review at amazoncouk i fortunate enough see and hear sandrine piau gorgeous cleopatra a magic performance of handel giulio cesare jacob baton a month ago here in amsterdam piaus stunning vocalism is sheer delight a is acting stage i tell what a divine voice her vocal lightness and agility restrained vibrato catching energy and musical imagination sandrine piau is the ideal baroque soprano putting famous overhyped handelian star singer in the shademore handel aria cd this recording go one superb track to another covering a great variety of dramatic sentiment and instrumental color of the twelve number on this disc is a carefully selected pearl particularly touching cleopatra despair in se pieta giulio cesare rodelindas grief her deceased husband in ombre piante melissa broken heart in ah spietato amadigi the intense drama in cor di padre tamerlano and deidamias distress at losing achilles in mai resa infelice i really couldnt wish for more on a desert islepiau is masterly accompanied christophe rousset and youthful ensemble le talens lyriques periodinstrument playing is sublime listen for example to the plaintive oboe in ah spietato and the tempestuous violin in combattuta da due venti a favor and buy this heavenly cd you wont regret it for a secondupdate piaus mozart aria cd is equally impressive you better buy disc

live album released hot heel masterpiece rubycon similarly gothic and gloomy atmosphere contrast live album however this sound like wa recorded in the studio the sound quality excellent and the audience heard apart the beginning and end of the piece ricochet wa cobbled together from live performance recorded the autumn of in france and britain the recording wa taken from a number of separate performance is evidence of in term of sound quality furthermore feel that the the performance seamlessly and expertly stitched togetherthe lineup on ricochet is the classic incarnation of the band edgar froese electric guitar bass guitar mellophonium mellotron vcs synthi chris franke double moog synthesizer synthi a organ piano vcs drum and peter baumann organ synthi a flute electric piano vcs the guy put in a great performance and edgar throw in slightly distorted electric guitar work spice thing a bitthe ricochet composition is split two part including ricochet pt and ricochet pt the music is classic tangerine dream with load of brooding analog synthesizer pulsating sequencer and dreamy atmosphere there small drum and electric guitar part and there the part this is a synthdominated album with quiet texture can be imagined there are element of album like rubycon and stratosphere on ricochet a very nice combination in factall in all this is a great album from the classic mids period of the band output and is highly recommended along with phaedra rubycon and stratosphere

brother roth set his sight a solo careerdaves early solo career good to teaming with steve vai guitar and billy sheehan bass the diamond one released the classic eat em and smile and although daves solo career started to dewind with skyscraper wa still a platinum hitcommercially speaking david lee roth lived and died the the quintessential s frontman served the blueprint s rocker simply couldnt find audience in the s a shame to daves first post vaisheehan album a little aint enough featuring guitarist jason becker regarded many of daves fan to his best work filthy little mouth with guitarist terry kilgore is a fine piece of musicone of the musically diverse and interesting album ever heard the album wa virtually ignored upon it releasebecause daves solo career hit the skid in the early s it would be easy for rhino to exclude many of roth later day solo cut thus botch up a daves greatest hit fortunately although it is skewed towards the early solo outing the best a pretty good job compiling daves best workif a casual fan and want the big hit the best is all youd ever need to and the best only all of daves biggest hit just a gigolo california girl yankee rose just like paradise
