following release mediocre widely ignored debut rocka rolla the member of juda priest wisely decided buckle and take their music seriously two year later the english quartet emerged surprisingly heavy and extremely powerful and hardrocking followup called sad wing of destiny release also extremely influential and would go to spawn legion of follower since went down the history book one of the earliest ever example of speed and thrash metal in fact it could said this album almost single handedly inspired a whole new generation of metal since thrashspeed metal band the s including venom iron maiden metallica and slayer the s ie pantera iced earth and the twentyfirst century see high on fire avenged sevenfold dragonforce three inch of blood bullet valentine etc cite it a a major influence in addition it also played important stepping stone in the development of the hard rock and traditional progressive power glam black doom groove and gothic metal genre this considered it indisputable that sad wing of destiny wa officially the first link in would turn to be a long chain of truly great groundbreaking and timeless record from the almighty priestgranted swod a perfect song sequencing the album fronttoback flow seem to get a little choppy time the song good and contagious enough to take that slack are chockablock full of delicious goody guitarist kk downing and glenn tipton are in top form and their surprisingly technical interplay is unbeatable together they lay down the music foundation with great meaty riff unique dualguitar lead and excellent winding solo the song are anchored an industrial strength rhythm section comprised of ian hill strong bass line and alan moore traditional and naturalsounding drumming and finally the legendary rob halford top it all of with worldrenowned lungstretching vocal irresistibly catchy chorus hook and interesting often fantastical lyric dreamer deceiver and genocide are of note for their really outofthisworld subject matterat around eight minute in length the opening victim of change wa juda priest first epic it begin with a fade in harmonized guitar part alternating catchy singlenote picking with galloping black sabbathy riff and a steady humming bass line throughout the verse robs beautiful singing voice soar the top of the mix and the song is completed by memorable chorus a slow gloomy breakdown and several tasty solo including an especially wailing one around the midpoint dreamer deceiver is another instant classic and is also arguably among the best ballad metal band ever recorded it is a positively beautiful and ethereal piece highlighted by a gorgeous multiparted melodic solo that last almost two whole minute and the kind of brilliant electrifying vocal performance that halford could give however this gentle nonthreatening power ballad is surrounded by two unexpectedly fast blitzkrieg the ripper is jack the ripper and deceiver are brisk charging straight forward and hard rocking sneak attack fueled by mindblowing fretwork including ton of inventive muscular crunching riffing the former is also of note for fairly hulking bass part in fact even might say the ripper is bassdriven moving along track five prelude is a moody and depressing neoclassical instrumental interludeafter that swod return to it aggressive root tyrant and genocide are both early thrash song and both are superbly and instantly catchy they are beefed up with strong deft skipping hook stellar twin guitar lead and cool blazing solo next come epitaph a really weird and proggy ballad that wouldnt have out of place on a queen recording it is based around a nice piano line and also find robs impressive proper and often soulful singing accented by angelically high backing vocal finally the album come full circle with it set closer island of domination which is another speedy and more driving number it boast gob of delicious propulsive chug and churn guitar lick that posse a classic rock and roll vibe and are arguably among glenn tiptons finest of alltimethe bottom line here is simple sad wing of destiny shouldnt be chalkedup a anything than a classic a landmark on heavy metal timeline an eargasmic listen and an essential purchase for anybody love music

new line cinema got brass one thats sure soundtrack sean penn vehicle sam consists entirely beatles cover recorded the like of the wallflower eddie vedder sheryl crow the black crowes may sound like recipe for disaster and thankfully arent bad eddie vedders bear soul the sublime youve got to hide love away is able to equal the mournful feel of the original and is the album standout track ever a band made to cover lucy in the sky diamond the black crowes and they disappoint with their trippy rendition highlight include ben fold faithful golden slumber rufus wainrights across the universe and the stereophonics interpretation of one of personal favorite dont let unfortunately practically rest of the album fall flat if i never to hear sheryl crow mother nature son ill die a happy man the track is downright bad and new line demand a refund on whatever they paid howie day help take every iota of life of the song by killing the original brisk pace and rendering it glacial nick cave barely even bother to sing one of the beatles inspirational track let it and paul westerbergs nowhere man the vine im sleeping and sarah mclachlans blackbird entirely unremarkable while new line should be applauded for the risk they took with this soundtrack they should the time be chastised for it lack of execution theyve managed to take the song of rock most revered and influential band and render them lifeless and forgettable would have thought it would ever be possible

recently purchased album normally i would went bought right away cof one favorite band i wanted rerelease let say a hard thing especially hearing the single version of the title track a sampler cd i know that cof taking a lot of heat even on damnation a day of album for selling out but honesty i think a good progression dusk embrace a good album quality musicianship and one of my favorite cof song ever red rose for the devil whore but it all sounded the and danis voice wa absolutely dreadful on it i know im gon na get a lot of nonhelpful review just for that last sentence but do keep mind that this is just my opinion and i just thought that dhe matter good the musicianship arrangement and lyric could often a dull album but cof have greatly evolved theyre no mean a black metal band anymore just amazing melodic metal band writes beautiful song people complain this album being overproduced but i think thats really it needsthe music wouldnt sound right it were raw and produced earlier cof album were are beautiful song that be heard a clearly a possiblenow ill move on to the actual music start with the expected scary intro track moving the album first real tune the brutal gilded cut this is definitely the one of the heaviest track on the record second only to mother of abomination but personally it one of my favorite though im not saying i dislike it by any mean it a good headbanger to get ready for what lay ahead basically the next track the sweeping nemesis is more melodic and is simply an awesome track complete with touching lyric and great guitar work other high light include track absinthine with faust forgive me if i spelled that wrong which is unusually catchy and feature hooky lyric even more great riff coffin fodder feature great dual guitar riffing and the more pianodriven track english fire stick in head for day but for me the real highlight of the album is nymphetamine overdose no doubt one of cofs greatest achievement a it cover the heaviest and brutal aspect to the most melodic and touching over it minute running time the fix version is the single which is basically the song with all the heavy part cut out and i loved that version too but after hearing the overdose version im amazed it start with a quick drum whack and the band kick into the jammiest riff ive ever heard play a riff you could easily tap your foot too then we go into a brutal few minute only before a ring out leading to the beauty heard in the fix version liv kristine a marvelous job on vocal a and dani play other amazingly telling mr filth doomed love story the song spends quite some time in this more melodic state only you go back into the heaviness you heard the beginning then the song over and despite it minute length youre willing to listen to it all over againthis album really show how talented cradle of filth are ignore their silly imagery and right hookyness and youll find a group of amazing songwriter dani stand a one of my favorite lyric writer of all time and with this album id say that cof deserves all the attention they have gotten this is truly inspirational metal music and any open minded metal fan should give it a listen

lester isnt overrated widelyacclaimed recording isexcept perhaps already familiar lester followed career to this meeting with oscar highfidelity longplaying record a young teen first saw lester a jatp concert in milwaukee i remember sight a wobbly woebegone creature who blind drunk apparently clueless wa although he blew his mouthpiece a time i couldnt hear a sound and i remember his leaving the stage with help supportive musician next introduction to prez wa this recording time i acquired a generous collection of gene ammons sonny stitt album dexter gordon and johnny griffin consequently this encounter lester and oscar wa insufficient to clinch the case prez a one leg of historic triumvirate of tenor titan with hawk and trane occupying the two positionsin hawk recorded body and soul became practically an instant classic in that year lester recorded lester leap in with an expanded basie rhythm section the latter recording wa largely ignoreduntil woodys nd herd brought u the four brother and stan getz who practically channeled lester durling the last half of a ralph burn instrumental that became a bonafide hit early autumn gradually but unmistakably became increasingly clear it wa lester perhaps other musician who made many aspiring musician choose the tenor saxophone ahead of any other instrument lester had become a school unto and at a time the music wa leaving the popular limelight and the cultural mainstream in favor of an increasingly countercultural direction he wa the personification of this new alternative ultra cool music written that it wa lester who popularized this apparently ineradicable permanent addition to vocabularydespite the irresistible pulse and swing generated by this oscar peterson rhythm section i cant help but sense that lester is occasionally scrambling on his horn to keep up moreover his sound doesnt have the foundation body that is present even on his airy freefloating highregister flight on the basie recording from the late on this recording he on the cusp of sounding a trifle fragile occasionally somewhat tentative and frail in other word i find in complete disagreement with those many reviewer and critic who vehemently denounce received wisdom that lester had lost his luster in the s in devotion to lester which in might seen a testimony to his influence and attraction feel practically dutybound to challenge the customary line on lester or mythie that he wa a sensitive artist whose humiliation at the hand of racist military superior led to mental depression alcoholism and all diminished creativity and facilityto degree the evidence support their caseie that lester returned to form playing better than ever listening to lester between and is to hear a far more powerful aggressive even virtuoso saxophonist one who frequently us the lower register of the horn the lester young trio from is an especially enjoyable session with nat king cole piano accompanying and soloing a imaginatively a lesters tenor buddy rich play tastefully yet on top of the beat to a degree found on the more flawless and polished but also more predictable and le engaging benny goodman trio recording with teddy wilson and gene krupa and when get to the jatp session with a rhythm section of hank jones rich and an inaudible ray brown lester lead lester leap in with an agile imaginative solo that practically rival the ensuing burst of creativity from the alto saxophone of charlie parker ill go with the lester apologist up to this historical point even though a few may argue that following his court marshal and subsequent dishonorable discharge from military service lester abandoned some of the key principle of the cool school that he had founded rather that saying more by playing le he often seems intent on proving he up to the challenge of the beboppers even overcompensating circumstance warrant improvising that verge on the pyrotechnicali still prefer the light high freefloating sound of prez the war but thats a personal preference his mastery of his instrument is unassailableat least not at any time the first half of the last century but the question about his playing throughout the s seems far more controversial ive read that listener are attracted to billie holiday recording from the s rather than to stellar columbia recording of the s and early s it understandable that for the same reason some listener may be similarily moved by prez recording from the s performance represents a kind of victory over ironclad internal and external force each represents a shout of defiance in the face of destiny decline and mortality itself are those who defend the performance of billie and prez on the celebrated sound of jazz cbs telecast from frankly many year i find the performance of both a trifle depressing which is not the bluesfine and mellow should ever be in the same year prez wa featured at the newport jazz festival a soloist in a basie reunion concert he play both lester leap in and polka dot and moonbeam a though they his last breathwhich wa not far from the truth to my ear he sound like a musician who with plenty of liquid assistance fortified himself in order not to incur embarrassment his sound is relatively secure but it also forced calcified woodenformulaic phrase emanating from a programmed orifice you enjoy that lester youll be enthralled by the more buoyant and creative lester of this verve recording but he no longer he old lester the perpetually young hip cool lester who ultimately became the president of the tenor saxophone during the first half of the last centuryif lester failed to retain office at the beginning of the century second half it wa le a question of his keeping up with the many eager and able younger player a flock owing no small part of it existence to lesters example than of maintaining the standard he himself had created lester showed the rest of u you could be conspicuously even stubbornly different from peersan innovator a quiet yet forceful influence a creative artist always at the forefrontwithout running away to form your band playing radically original music whether in or of office prez wa one of u after many duke count king bird hawk etc finally had a creative giant who wa not royalty or some sort of nonhuman specie lester young perhaps more than any other musician in this music history epitomized a delicate balance between individualism and community that is the essence of an indigenous liberal a in changing democratic art and thats jazz

patience completely necessary listening record mean that good news people that love bad news gnfptlbn is obvious a earlier work modest mouse and company i admit the departure of green i certainly worried and i think presence could missed live setting the heart of this record remains the essence that is modest mouse dan galluccis return brings a shift that reminds of the fruit that ate and gnfptlbn also find the band taking little piece of of the previous record albeit slightly condensed tightened and streamlined but i truly think that piece of this is a drive lonesome crowded and moon amp antarctic swirl at the heart of this record patience is however necessary and reveals the magic and beauty that exists within with repeated listens the cohesion of the record becomes much obvious and the intricate touch a horn banjo picking and come to the forefront and entertain the listener in a different way and in a new rewarding experience with subsequent listens i for one love this record and always a place turntable the good news is that this record is a wonderful chapter in the evolution of modest mouse

bought album came initially i disappointed and shelved it i recently replayed it and found id made mistake this album a very good closer first and greatest chapter black sabbath careeron never say die find a band in transition the doom metal sound pioneered sabbath is largely gone darker themed song the void war pig replaced a positive atmosphere the guitar still heavy sabbath got more experimental with this album flirting with jazz and even horn the instrumental break out the album sound like the bridge oldschool doom laden sabbath and a more sounding metal album albeit one with a hell a lot more experimentation and variety metal band attempted in the snot everything work such a the aforementioned break out but great hard hitting rocker never say die jonny blade hard road and shock wave the bill ward sung song swinging the chain close out the album and is excellent heavy song ozzy play harmonica on this one junior eye is a standout blue influenced track with tremendous guitar playing but in the typical black sabbath mode the most unusual song the excellent air dance some very fast jazz inflected soloing tonyfantastic stuff but i see this album is slagged by the fan it strength are it experimention with new song form and it flirtation with jazz are also to many fan never say dy weakness it doesnt sound like previous black sabbath album the song are more overtly positive it not the old doom and heavyness we came to expect from sabbath which is not necessarily a bad thing never say die is better than the previous album technical ecstacy and is the last real black sabbath album ozzy left black sabbath retrenched brought in dio and went for a more overt and generic heavy metal sound ozzy went on to fame and fortune with solo career it a good thing ozzy left it wa to the benefit of involved obviously couldnt work together anymore and pulling in different direction sabbath fan with open ear like this last effort with ozzy check it out

classical process the new generation born the twenty rediscovering webern and schoenberg ready change the history the serialism it peak timbre duration dynamic everything wa pre determinate le marteau sans maitre read a new way to see one of the most important work of the first half of the twentieth century pierrot lunaire by arnold schoenberg schoenberg wrote work in three part different subject in of the three part pierre boulez handle with three part three song based in three poem by rene char and each song one instrumental precedent commentary the order isnt easy to understand let take the three first movement of the workit begin with a intricate fast scherzo it is one precedent of the song lartisanat furieux a commentary of another song bourreaux de solitude than the first time one of the song lartisanat furieux this one is a clear homage to schoenberg a in the seventh song of pierrot lunaire we have hear a music to voice and solo flute and a in pierrot lunaire boulez control the extension of the pause the movement of the work the sound of le marteau sans maitre include exotic sound like the african and popular in bahiabrazil agg and the caribbean maraca and the end of the work evokes something of oriental music the surrealist text are placed in a very sophisticated atmosphere the result is fantastic at the end we have a fusion between the voice and the instrument dont have to play or to conduct this work forget the difficulty of the score enjoy the sound the ambience and the fantastic relation between text and musicbefore this recent performance pierre boulez recorded several time this work there are two of version that are remarkable one with the mezzo jeanne deroubaix the flutist in this record wa the fantastic severino gazzeloni and with the famous canadian mezzo yvonne minton with fantastic musician a the percussionist sylvio gualda and the flutist michel debost would like to remember that there is one very interesting old recording in lp conducted by robert craft and curiously this is the one to follow the crazy metronomic marc of the score boulez never followed metronomic indication and this new recording is the slower of all the young musician of the ensemble intercontemporain play this music a if it were easy a never we have hear a fluency and one constant beauty of sound the mezzo soprano hilary summer ha a beautiful voice and intonation is simply perfect her range is perfect for this music in short this is the most fluent and the most perfect performance of le marteau sans matre and technically the sound of the recording is outstanding a a bonus we have two other masterpiece deacuterive and the wonderful deacuterive concluded in this recent composition ha instrumental color of a profound beauty written for instrument it share the atmosphere of sur incises and of reacutepons deacuterive is a testimony of the energy of this young year old composer maybe the most important musician of the second half of the twentieth century this recording give you the opportunity to know composition that arent easy but one can deny that these are work among the really important work of the last year these work deserve attention

richard carpenter hooked quaalude submitted menninger clinic in topeka kansa to rid himself the additction would take year music and the carpenter rather remain idle time karen carpenter decided to make a solo album and chose the accomplished new york producer phil ramone to guide this wa a startling break karen never made a single record anyone richardthe album took over a year to make and the sound of karen carpenter singing solo quite different than her previous song with richard richard carpenter learned to make multitrack overdubbings from listening to favorite childhood recording duo le and mary paul and he used the overdubbing technique to give the carpenter sound rich distictive quality is little of in the karen carpenter solo album and hearing karen sing to a simple musical accompaniment is very different indeed different in fact that richard carpenter herb alpert and the recording label back in los angeles put pressure on karen to release the album intense closeddoor meeting karen reluctantly relented and decided to shelve her album thus it wa never releasedfast forward to year after karen tragic death from anorexia nervosa compications with richard pressure from longing fan to hear karen shelved album he finally decides to release the album in the liner note karen lovinging dedicates her solo project to richardnot is this a different karen carpenter sound the image portrayed and the lyric of the song decidedly sexier than anything karen had attempted karen image on the record cover is hip with her posing on a couch dressed in leather the sexier image wa needed wa presenting song lyric that had a sexual overtone to themmaking love in the afternoonremember lovin took all nightmy body keep changing mindmake believe it first timestill crazy after all yearskaren wa quite proud of her solo effort and wa devastated when it wa shelved so much so that she went on a mexican vacation with the phil ramone family for several week upon returning to the state she and richard would embark on last album together made in americaunbelievably karen not consider a great singer despite the many accolade she received from fan she attributed the success of her song to richard due to the lush arrangement he created around her voice so to make a solo album wa a definite step of faith and independence for karen and she wa placing herself on a limb so to speak for the success failure of this albumthe album wa made during the height of the intense but short disco craze and thus many of the track a disco sound and beat to others have a rock sound and a have a county lilt to them demonstrating karen ability to diversify her beautiful voice for several reason this album wa delayed in production mid and then the disco fad wa dead and top wa changing a well many station abandoning the format in favor of talk radio or country thus the delayed production time of karen album made it release more difficult a it had a disco theme to it this is one of the reason the am braintrust did not favor releasing the album feared the failure of the album would hurt karen carpenter image and standing plus they simply did not like karen singing without richards arrangementsyou hear a very different karen carpenter on this album fan are split on the album like the new sound and some not am in the latter group richard had a talent for selecting musical material that best fit karen voice and brought out her outstanding vocal sound this album stray from that and not have the layering and overdubbing so common to previous carpenter song for this reason i did not enjoy this album a much a say made in america i am a huge fan of karen considering her to my favorite singer ao alltime but without richards arrangement karen solo effort in my opinion strike a bland keyyou need to decide for so buy this album and make your carpenter collection completejim konedog koenig carpenter fan

film karajans salzburg production of carmen finally dvd marked the first time bizet opera recorded on film may unfamiliar this is recorded the salzburg festival is it even live recording it is a filmed memento of the production first premiered at the salzburg festival wa restaged for the festival with a slight change of cast karajan wa notorious for avoiding live recording wanted the kind of perfection recording which could be achieved in the studio the music wa recorded at the sofiensaal in vienna and the filming took place in munich germany it is a lipsynched performance well done production value very high the staging is superb the sumptuous set the gorgeous costume to the huge supporting cast which even included rider on horsebackthere are several difference the original festival production and the film version karajan managed to assemble of the finest force available for the festival for the film itself he went even bringing in the venerable vienna philharmonic orchestra and the vienna state opera chorus and childrens chorus to replace the original salzburg festival orchestra and chorus he changed the lineup of singer several time he wa satisfied he the right mix he even imported the ballet de espantildea preferring for authenticity the traditional staatsoper balleta still young grace bumbry is in full bloom the sultry fiery carmen jon vickers excellent job spanning the emotional spectrum from shy young soldier to jealous lover to enraged murderer mirella freni with wonderfully expressive voice is simply enchanting a the kind noblehearted micala outshines everyone else here and tends to steal every scene she is in and of course get to see long stretch of karajan in the prelude and the three entractes eye perpetually closed seemingly in bliss a he conduct the vienna philharmonic in the darkened orchestra pit the effect is to give the impression are watching a live performance and that performance is without question a glorious triumphas a note of interest karajan performs the older version of carmen using the sung recitative written ernest guiraud he would later rerecord carmen for deutsche grammophon with baltsa carreras van dam ricciarelli the bpo using the longer oeser critical edition with expanded music and bizet original spoken dialogue bumbry vickers and freni would also go on to record the newer version with spoken dialogue rafael fruumlhbeck de burgos but this is the only occasion the principal participant would come together and a an historical document old new it is to be treasured another peculiarity of this production is karajans inclusion of music from bizet larleacutesienne including the famous showstopping farandole for the extended spanish dance sequence at lillas pastias tavern this wa obviously meant a a showcase for the ballet de espantildea and acquit admirablythis film wa shot in aspect ratio fullscreen the brilliant color of the costume and set are caught in full technicolor splendor deutsche grammophon either gotten hold of a pristine print or ha taken the trouble of restoring it for dvd it look superb is almost dirt or nick to speak of the picture is crystal clear and sharp the color really leap a lovely transfer overall sound is in the original uncompressed pcm stereo along with a new dts remix the sound is good although a mite aggressive personally prefer the plain old stereo there are cuing track but unfortunately no direct access via the menu you need to read the track content from the booklet the original french libretto along with english and spanish translation are available a optional subtitle this is an altogether outstanding production of carmen which hold it later cinematic version

united two year the band member took the time challenge musically and lyrically hillsong united offer creative collection of new song that celebrates the one save redeems and is the true representation of hope in a world hopelessness abounds known worldwide worship anthem the stand from the inside hosanna and lead to the cross eagerly await new hillsong united release the last united studio recording of the in aftermath open a new song written and sung by joel houston called take heart is epic opening track over minute long and it set the tone nicely for the new album contemplative and reflective similar to a beautiful exchange joel song always moved me and sings with an emotional intensity go is next and certainly the concert anthem from album in the style of take it all and one way the song includes the classic coldplaytype guitar riff that i eagerly anticipate with each new album and pick the britrock torch from recently retired delirious interestingly the opening set of song the britrock sounding the album a the last several song transition over to a electronic rock style similar to keane and phil wickham ive singing the stand from the inside out mighty to save soon and many hillsong classic church for many year and i expect will be several more worship classic from this album one of the standout song to me is the next song like an avalanche the female vocal are beautiful and although brooke fraser ligertwood is part of this album the song engages me similar to lead me to the crossrhythms of grace is a cool song and like most hillsong united song it a great melody and great congregational chorus there is none beside god there is none beside you god i live my life to shine light there is none beside you god title track aftermath is another ballad and really anchor the theme of this album with the worshipful lyric in a moment of glorious surrender you broken for all the world to see lifted out of the ash i found in the aftermath the album change musical style with an instrumental interlude be flow a synthrock song called bone which ha another stellar female vocal and id love to sing this song with fellow believer for sure this will be one of the most popular song from the new album and musically reminds me of the killer one of my favorite band nova really grab me with the upbeat musical style and i seen this amazing band live in concert i expect this to be another great song to hear performed livelight will shine is synthrock at it best and really display the musical talent of this band the song sound like many mainstream alternative rock hit ive enjoyed over the year with an unashamed gospel message first single search my heart also ha a pulsing electronic beat and i find singing the great chorus all the time with all my heart and all my soul with all i am lord i will follow you you took the cross you took my shame restored my life i live to worship you awakening is my favorite new worship anthem of the past year which i hope will soon be a song ill be singing with fellow believer awakening ha a great worshipful chorus which end with let your will be done in me which is the cry of my heart a well the song also appeared on the last passion album and most recently chris tomlins studio album cowritten with reuben morganclosing thoughtsim impressed by the consistent quality and fresh worshipful song that come from hillsong united aftermath is exception for me the standout song are go like an avalanche bone nova search my heart and awakening aftermath is a musthave for your praise and worship collection

heard early fleetwood mac studio recording get thinking the studio doesnt doesnt bear all the greatness of the original machowever cd live set showcase all the raw energy of peter green jeremy spencer danny kirwan john mcvie and mick fleetwood three cd fleetwood mac powerful and forceful recording track played with high energy also represents everything that the early fleetwood mac blue to progressive jam product of peter green and danny kirwanto parody product of jeremy spencer to pop rock product of danny kirwan making the set varied the highest sense of the word disc one dominated blue and rock original by green and kirwan black magic woman jumping shadow like it this way and you well are also long dueling guitar jam rattlesnake shake green manalishi plus the slide guitar elmore james parody of jeremy spencer i cant hold got to move though the sound is poor this is the best of the three disc disc two variety starting with the pop instrumental of world in harmony later the bside to the green manalishi and the legendary fast guitar blue of oh well that wa the original mac most famous accomplishment then come another rendition of rattlesnake shake wa another dueling guitar jam that take many twist and turn then jeremy spencer come to the mic to perform elmore james coversstranger blue red hot mama and s parody teenage darling keepaknocking jenny jenny disc two end with a encore jam featuring joe walsh and eric clapton weakest of the three cd though still great disc three follows the trend with another cover of jumping at shadow and the green original which sound like another s parody sandy mary and then pure bb king blue in you let love you then danny kirwan step to the mic the first time since disc one to play the blue rock of loving kind coming way jeremy spencer dominates the rest of the disc with trademark elmore james madison blue got to move the sun is shining oh baby and s cover tiger great ball of fire tutti frutti the three night in boston come to end with a fantastic encore jam in conclusion this is a great live set it feature everything that wa the original fleetwood mac though the sound of the recording is uneven the performance overides all the problem it is always exciting and energetic and never boring get it get the three cd separately youre still getting the same great product

death metal scene day becoming quite homogenous nile definitely made effort stand the crowd think that is the reason annihilation the wicked receiving much attention the last year so is deviation from death metal triedandtrue formula a good thing i guess thats a matter of opiniongood point first one possibly the foremost nile use of the egyptian themme in lyric and music help add atmosphere in abundance this is a good thing considering normally death metal ha roughly much atmosphere a the moon even so this doesnt mean that theyre lacking one iota of heaviness the contrary nile one of the brutal death metal band out possibly second to zyklon and maybe cryptopsy on a good day have speed and groove enough to make deicide jealous and a previous reviewer have mentioned the drumming on offer is par way above par in fact of this add to a perfectly good solid death metal albumso may ask could they have done to cost a full two star well first the main reason karl sander ha what is quite possibly the worst extreme metal vocal i have heard in life far from the beautifully agonised howl of the gothenburg master like tomas lindberg or mikael stanne or even the cookie monster growl of standard death metal fare the vocal performance on offer here is a weak monotonous muffled mumble a ridiculously low pitch seriously only fall short of comical im and i stronger growl thesethere are fault here and there a well for one the blastbeats on offer here nile just havent quite found the knack for making synchronise properly the rest of the music a problem they share with hate eternal whats is that the song structure are imperfect youll often find it jumping from one pace to another without warning and it just doesnt feel graceful the way it shouldso do i reccomend this i couldnt say you want a death metal album with a difference youre welcome to try it but youll have to prepared to put up with noticable fault

astute jazz listener may noticed have convienently borrowed title one of gato barbieris previous cd use the title of review dont win prize congratulation wracking brain for heading to gatos wonderful que pasa album the term caliente meaning fire seemed incredibly appropriate for album that carry much heat true passion a well apology aside let explain this disc so powerfulother the song europa to found a previous cd entitled caliente written carlos santana i unaware of anything by this extrodinary tenor sax player and shame on for that i listened to two track que pasa played by my local smooth jazz station and i thought interesting i didnt rush to make any quick purchase againshame on me for odd reason i finally came to my sens the day and picked a copy and rarely left my cd player since you call this smooth jazz ouch youd like but i like to think that gato is actually quite a bit than that and please no boney james comparison be forewarned though that gatos playing is impressively strong and full bodied fact the disc is recorded so loud that i found rushing to my cd player to turn the volume started to play i have extremely thin wall and testy neighbor anyway starting the disc straight to the sunrise is gato best playing while holding nothing back simply breathes fire this song and let the listener know to expect for the rest of this wonderful album blue gale is a worthy followup tune that is just a melodic and forceful a anything else youre likely to hear and with some truly remarkable percussionist surrounding it only add to the intensity of the set i want to mention dance with dophins an unfortunate title to a wonderfully stirring number that may be my favorite track on the disc the album a a whole capture an almost exotic feel with pulsating rhythm some smooth background vocal and gatos talent for pushing song with some truly inspired melody into a different stratosphere fortunately each song is distinctive from the next and no doubt youll be asking he all year a opposed to where have been all these year in ending while im aware is an army of smooth jazz sax player out there ie dave koz walter beasley boney james and steve cole to name but a you may want to give this aging argentinian a listen those other kid it always a nice experience to say nothing of educational to hear where these other artist learned chop from a for me im still listening to gato by the way mean cat in spanish and thinking of asking my neighbor to join me que pasa

a i feared the arrangement are a sharp departure from the version many people are accustomed to hearingdonny osmond doe a fine job with rosie on winter wonderland the backup vocal also work well for libertine gone another revival band being held pedestal the british music press comparison to the clash the beatles one the great relationship dynamic british rock history the constant struggle the two main artistic mind carl bart pete doherty have making headline ever since debut single a waster with the libertine prove theyve got what take to stay remembered without a certain amount of frustration and eyerolling the libertine have of their standout material on like cant stand last post on the bugle and what became of the likely lad one cant help but annoyed by the pretentious nature of the song the band trying to make a classic but their horribly obvious selfawareness be irritating especially all the tabloid taken consideration the album is selfreferential and it come a the libertine trying too hard to be what came naturally to on the bracket a great band with a great backstory the little warmups song and the coke snorting leadins are a little too much time even are a libertine fan the digital recording of the record also leaf something to be desired and feel empty when compared to the warm sound found on up the bracket despite nitpicky shortcoming the libertine liveinthestudio sound demand attention and rightfully so the sheer fun of the pirate singalong tomblands and the short but insanely catchy arbeit mach frei are a blast and the sloppy raw sound captured on disc is quite appealing even if it is digital while this is far from a perfect effort the libertine have made a decent album and are able to change thing up fairly well throughout the course of the cd and with greater ease shown on their primary influence the stroke room on fire sadly all the trouble between pete and carl too much strain on the band them to continue performing together but the libertine stand a a fitting end to a very selfconscious controversial and amazing band

time kennedy camelot is full flower the white house wanted thank summer intern service and better way to rose garden concert the dave brubeck quartet and tony bennett performer their zenith with the world a string around their finger jazz aficionado long salivated at the thought what concert must have like putting two incomparable performer together the excitement the performance swelled the size of people wanting to attend requiring a larger venue so the concert moved to the nearby sylvan theater the washington monument on a balmy late august night the setting and the performer truly to a show to remember sadly the concert recorded the tape of the show were lost what wa lost is found and sad that this come so shortly the great dave brubecks passing yet it a great reminder of what innovator wa and sharp quartet wa at the time that the performer were so sharp and to the task is testament to their skill and talent had time to rehearse and the entire concert set wa largely put together on the fly while individually the brubeck quartet and bennett were confident in their set the two were going to perform together and neither had done so talk a high wire act but a supremely talented performer this high riskhigh reward gamble wa likely to pay and so in spade early on in his set bennett appears a bit taken aback and nervously say dont know whats going to happen but wish luck clearly luck wa on everyones sidebrubecks quartet open the show demonstrating their intense improvisational skill and swinging like there no tomorrow their hit take five open the set and the quartet take the audience on a global tour with nomad thank and castilian blue all knowing nod to the quartet service a global ambassador of american music and their service overseas to a grateful government thank you in particular is an often overlooked gem by the quartet and they play it with a gleeful abandon that is truly captivating by the end of castilian blue i truly didnt want the party to endtheres so many song that era of the quartet id love to hear and im sure the audience wa dying for a a kid id never cared much for tony bennett but a time pass i realize what a genuine talent he is that honeyed voice and his incomparable phrasing is truly a beauty to behold and he holding forth in rare form here his take on make someone happy here is probably the best version ive ever heard and his take on one for baby is likewise top shelf bennett is in his element and killing it the money shot here is the final third of the show the quartet return to back up bennett on a romp though the classic american songbook and here is high riskhigh reward playing out and paying out together they remake and remodel classic a lullaby of broadway chicago that old black magic and never be another you with such finesse and virtuoso performance that youre dying the show end surely there must be an encore they play a more sadly no and listening to this i could almost imagine sitting on the mall taking this all in and screaming for more im sure the audience and so will you what make this recording so memorable and beautiful is that it capture these artist in full flower in front of an ecstatic audience in a truly memorable venue giving what may perhaps be the performance of their life the sound quality is actually quite good given the limitation of live recording equipment at the time and the whole thing fairly crackle with life and vitality able to sit in and listen is the rarest privilege and treat and one i want to repeat and again

tupac shakurs vault unrelease material run deeper rap fan imagine basis many quotmakavelian alive theoriesquot a subject of various discussion hiphop world truth the last album that pac alive see the release for wa the classic double lp eyez little know that music would continue the dark war cry of makaveli the killuminati the early work of r u still the outlawz backed still rise and various unreleased music included in his greatest hit album and various soundtrack the end of time continues the tradition of tupac speaking beyond the first of two double disc that to released in the year many argue that this release is reworked version of tupac music that wa never meant to be released is arguing that it tupac shakur best speaking his mind beat been reworked and remixed from there original form what make pac music is the potent lyric what fire tupac music is the anger sadness and passion that the man injects his every word demanding the world to listen even his passing quotballad of a dead souljaquot is the first track and arguably the strongest one of the album pac challenge the listener to step into the world of anger and deceit that eventually caused his end the album greatest moment however are heard tupacs introspective lyric concentrate on hope and yearning for all that he cant seem to grasp quotwhen thug cryquot quothappy homequotquotletter to unbornquot and quotuntil the end of timequot all showcase the talent that he for penning lyric that reached deep into his soul for answer on life struggle while type of track make of the album the anger and hatred that he had for enemy including jayz among others can be heard throughout vicious dis on war oriented song cluboriented track quotlet em have itquot also add to the diversity of the album overall the album showcase that tupacs music isnt going anywhere and that even after death hell be the quotlast one breathinquot

two album recorded close together mid seventy fitting paired twofer announced that the great phil spector would make a whole album the one only dion expectation were high despite the fact that men were past glory day perhaps the pairing would jump start the magic they both possessed inthe past well the album wa considered a dismal failure it wa only released in england so it american debut and dion stated that this recording wa one unhappy experience in the recording studio the time it didnt matter wa a huge fan of both and tracked import copy right the bat when the title track kick inor rather it doesnt say quotoh it going to be like thisquot i dont think anybody ray charles could slow down a tune to a dirgelike tempo and get away with it but it that quotborn to be with youquot minute of it is a pretty good song and nino tempo sax work is the best part of it but spector ha sucked joy thats inherit in the song this is an affirmationoflove song the sound and mix so dense so muddy that dion is barely like the big ha this gigantic shadow hovering that keep treatening to swallow him right out of the record the following song get pretty much the treatment quotonly you knowquot amp quotmake the woman love mequot are good number given the same dirgelike treatmentwith dion managing to pump in tenderness thus raising song stature in the process however there is quotnew york city songquot taken this is one of the best tune to come dions hand sings with total involvement and genuine world weariness it is also one of the two song not produced by spector quotin amp out of the shadowsquot is a magnificent failure with spector pushing dion to sing way beyond his considerable vocal range youll want to play it immediately to hear youve just heard this production is haunting but it drawback ultmately serve a metaphor the whole project the final numberquotgood lovinquot manquot is what quotthe wandererquot would sounded like spector produced it a pretty good record and ill bet it wa the first number they recorded the last spector treat dion like he most of his artist save the beatles he worked with a just another instrument in his wall of sound but on all his great record he always gave the artist a spotlight of his or own to shine in he cloak dion in darkness with a capital d dion god bless him bounced back artistically with streetheart he cowrote and coproduced if the spector production wa heavy streetheart go a little overboard on the opposite end by making the production too light too la in the daytime if you get drift working with spector you blame him the song however are way better the production would have you believe but the song are sequenced badly really badly the original cassette version flipped side one and two for the better so someone must have aware this album didnt hang right quotyou showed what love isquot find dion at his most exhuberant it the unknown gem in dions catalogue quotmore to you than meet te eyequot is one his most romantic tune and youll find yourself slow dancing with lady the second chorus quotif i can just get the nightquot is dion battling with his demon with love a his only possible salvation his vocalizing on the temptation quotthe way you the thing you doquot is easy and playful but should have never kicked off this album of otherwise orginal material the dramatic quotheymy lovequot and quotlover boy supremequot round off the best cut but the gem is the minute title track and just dig the way dion scat out his vocal at the end giving way to the saxmans romantic solo just beautfula interesting pairing of two album by one of music finest artist darkness and light

ever wonder kraftwerk would sound like acoustic drum think kraftwerks later album bit repetitive ever wonder guy would sound like if they rocked if you answered yes of these question you may really enjoy album like dome i love kraftwerk even though im a huge fan of album trans europe express some people may say doesnt really make a kraftwerk fan i consider this first album to one of their bestif not thee best album theyve ever done i like the use of live acoustic drumming i like florians breathy flute playing like the band actually rock out time albeit a nonconventional king crimson like way and importantly i really like these song the first three minute of the opening track ruckzuck favorite thing kraftwerk ever done florian play a very breathy rhythmic and staccato flute line actually several flute line a four or five note organ riff ralf and some somewhat unsteady drumming and a very simple bass line may be the coolest thing ive ever heard do at the three minute mark the song go in a completely different direction but then return to the main theme at the endthe two longest track stratovarius and von himmel hoch are the two heaviest track and also the most exciting exciting is not a word i usually use to describe kraftwerks music but it certainly applies the heavier part of the song are pretty intense and exciting the band getting in some pretty good jamming the guitar and violin playing bring to my mind king crimson their lark tongue in aspic period the hand megaherz is a very quiet and reflective piece and in line with some of the ambient music on their next three albumsthere is vocal one cant sing along to any of it and are no danceable rhythm so one cant dance to it very different from later kraftwerk album and all the more better it a great album

owned recording several year frequently play generally hear prokofiev classical symphony the work enjoyable the classical symphony i enjoy the mostthe performance three are done crisply and cleanly rather extraordinary string sound played cello for many year i have knowledge of live string sound and this recording come much closer to capturing the special sound that string have live performance that alone awakens memoriesi find this recording refreshing that perspective alone the beauty of the music and the quality of the performance are like icing the cake may guess im interested in quality music reproduction and place value on the quality of the performance a well a the quality of the recording this recording excels in both categoriesthe cd includes a booklet a picture of the youthful member of the orpheus chamber orchestra the picture show the musician with instrument and seems to include flute oboe clarinet bassoon violin viola cello and string bassthe orpheus chamber orchestra based in new york city continues to perform and make a name for following the philosophy of playing with conductor in the spirit of the small string ensemble and even rotating position of leadership you put orpheusnyc browser and check you find interesting photo of the ensemble it the time recorded this discif you enjoy string sound well recorded with the string ensemble performing beautifully youll find this cd an enjoyable addition to your library

write review intrepid ditty bop beginning bike music tour la ny go amanda go abbyi caught the ditty bop the dance stage and americana stage merlefest last month wilkesboro nc totally smitten i bought their debut album produced none mitchell froom wife purchased the ditty bop risque bike bikini calendar i speak for u i say vavavoommoonlight the freeway continues the ditty bop collaboration froom producer suzanne vega los lobos know to put stamp on a project letting the musician their thing amanda barrett and abby dewald are amazing singer their songwriting really taken since the debut album their unique st century cabaret sound soar on cut like nosy neighbor and aluminum the instrumentation is clear and nearly acoustic with odd accordion toy piano and lap steel joining the guitarmandolin party the album ha cut a clunker in the bunch the sole cover is a sweet harmonious version of the everlys bye bye loveas a final note the ditty bop are complete entertainer enjoy the entire processfrom the music to the costume to the stage presentation they also the best website of new act check out the femme fatales of fun youll glad

reach the conclusion a i didon the heel of those recent terrible rolling stone remasters universal applied the same odious loudness compression method to another high profile catalog queen if youre not familiar term the technical explanation the application of increasingly high ratio of compression to the dynamic range of particular recording and increasing the gain of the recording the peak have reached maximumin layman term are longer any quiet or loud passage in the recording everything is the same volume go to wikipedia and search loudness war in that article there is also a link to an excellent you tube audiovideo demonstrationbasically the ubiquity of the ipod is the culprit in this plague music is played back thru earbuds in any environment with ambient noise present having the volume artificially jacked across the entire music spectrum you hear the content clearlywhen you listen to new queen edition in a home system however a sheer wall of high volume sound there is no dynamic range remaining the vocal instrumentation and orchestration are now in competition rather being in harmony with and the overall volume of each album is much louder than the previous version there is also a noticeable loss of clarity in the cymbal the release sound much sharper on the japan discsall of this add to a real heartbreaker a lot of the bonus material is excellent and queen fan have waiting for a long time for this kind of look the hoodthere also no reason to split the bonus material to a nd disc on any of these release other than to charge a higher price for each title none of these album with respective bonus material approach the full capacity of a cd there wa even room on each album disc to include not only the new bonus material also the bonus track the earlier until theyve also been discounted

fair bit activity big of thrash metal the last couple of month of ha been good some great some plain lulu happy set the tone of review stating worship music fall the second category it great thrash metal pure and simplei always enjoyed the contrast that i have seen the metallica megadeth brand of thrash and that of anthrax thrash ha a little dose of punk thrown into it anthrax have always seemed to veer to the punk side of life than californian contemporary i am sure that this ha a lot to their exposure to the thriving new york punk scene in the sall of that been said this album is a pure delight to listen to a fantastic blend of fast punkish number and slower more grooveladen metal with some seriously catchy chorus thrown in between im alive spring to mind i found getting more and more into the album it went alongsince comparison between band inevitable let lay it a i see it i have yet sufficient time to listen properly to megadeths new offering thrten from initial impression it is a great album i find it completely impossible to listen to metallicas latest project with lou reed and probably not try time soon with worship music i think that possibly the first time anthrax is longer the little guy in the big it is undoubtedly to me the best that the band have ever released and it is quickly rising to the top of thrash metal pile for the time beingin conclusion there is no real need to think any further need this album in collection make it

m graytake bowthe sophomore album never easy obstacle overcome especially debut album question is the successful multiplatinum quoton life isquot ohli macy gray rose to the surface a talent pool made of boy band teen temptress seattle leftover a sound unlike anything weve ever heard with a unique sound is part child part packdaysmoker m gray knock sock againthe first track quotrelating to a psychopathquot could easily fit beck quotodelayquot a on quotthe idquot a psychedelic rock and rampb jam that set the entire mood the cd quotsexual revolutionquot is a song for a millennium crowdsassy sexy and completely grooveworthy the stand quotsweet babyquot featuring erykah badu is reminiscent of gray first album with much richer orchestration quotgimme lovinquot although lyrically disturbing is an incredible song musically that overlook the rather morbid lyric quotdont come aroundquot is a jazzy blue ballad in you cant help but hear arethas influence quotfreak like mequot and quotharryquot the album guilty pleasurespop song that are well produced that you forget that theyre pop song and finally one of personal favorite quotforgivenessquot which is smooth like butter and an allaround beautiful song wish that it ended the albumthere are a quotoddquot choice for lack of a better word i could definitely without quothey young worldquot even though it cool to see macy do a song with slick rick the complete miss is the freaky quotoblivionquot which is part cabaret part fiddler on the roof and part carnival sideshow it honestly place on otherwise flawless album and take my rating to starsbuy this cd with an open mind and dont expect to hear a boring carbon copy of quoton how life isquot youll disappointed quotthe idquot stand on it a a unique and worthwhile sophomore effort miss graytake a bow

job of accentuating the feeling of the music and made it seem a little bit nobeler it seems that more time wa taken to arrange the music for some song more others and for good reason is really much that you can do with adding an orchestra to some of the material i think that adding to quotthe call of the ktuluquot wa a tiny bit easier than adding to quotfuelquot an excellent production nonethless it quite admirable that metallica wanted to try something new and daring not too many band the ball to rock with an orchestra and make it sound good not only is the listener presented with a good live music experience a is always presented the tallica boy a previously mentioned a lot more power and depth is added by the orchestra some favorite of this one include quotthe call of the ktuluquot quotmaster of puppetsquot quotthe devil dancequot quotfor the bell tollsquot and quotonequot it hard to really pick some favorite since mostly all the material is good i had to pick an absolute favorite i would have to choose quotthe thing that not bequot their rendition is evil sounding and this strange type of edgar allen poe edge to it truly fascinating james also add some feeling to the mix with some rant and laugh you know wa fun the new song quotnoleaf cloverquot and quothumanquot excellent cut a well quothumanquot is a new venture for metallica with it low grungy droppedd type sound is ironically is a new area of exploration for the four horseman a sound which wa fought so feverishly by the metal band in the early ninety it an excellent production and really lightningquot for quotbatteryquot but thats much too critical and trivial this is obviously a must for old and new metallica fan if youre not a metallica fan you may want to explore this one anyway it material should start to look like three long year without a large amount of new material if anything love it hate it you must admit that this is a very stylish and excellent way to release a quotgreatest hitsquot album a oppossed to putting remasters of the old material into a boring compilation if you dont already have this one you must have a good reason

performance heard of the mahler th cd may the beautiful sounding the orchestral playing together the quality of this recent remastering especially with respect the string playing this performance for reach apogee the final adagio barbirolli the berlin phil play with ardent and glowing lyric beauty in distinct contrast to the darkly stoic quality horenstein in the bbc legend brings to this supremely transcendent music main caveat that in the first movement though beautifully played and well shaped barbirolli bring the starkly tragic intensity permeating with the trenchancy of the aforementioned horenstein bernstein in various recording the live kubelik and walter performance part of the reason for this for this i feel is that doe not use rubato to shape the climax for maximum impact conductor furthermore barbirolli fails to bring out the passage in the second movement that convey wistful longing or nostalgia in distinction to the other conductor mentioned largely he doe not slow the tempo sufficiently moment nevertheless i rank this performance a one of the premiere mahler th for the reason given and at midprice and on single disc is an excellent introduction to this great work

tragedy new opportunity sometimes spring passing of vocalist chris gaffney the hacienda brother shuttered gaffneys partner dave gonzalez left seek new musical outlet a founding member of the californiabased paladin gonzalez explored rockabilly and blue and crafted a reputation a ace electric guitarist work with gafney three hacienda brother studio album refined his playing with quieter country and southern soul flavor his new partner the texasbased mike barfield cut his teeth leading the houstonbased hollisters folding together countryrock hillbilly twang tictac train rhythm and deadpan baritone vocal brought to mind johnny cash and john doe two group album barfield turned solo issuing the superbliving stereoin barfields second solo albumthe tyrant wa heavier on the funk rhythm his debut and though element of that remain new collaboration his background in southern soul blue and swamp rock that make a natural fit with gonzalez this isnt hacienda brother mark ii a barfield and gaffney different singer and songwriter the song including a wellselected cover draw on similar source barfield reprises his cover of tyrone davis change mind appeared on living stereo in raw form the earlier twin guitar lead are replaced dave billers pedal steel and james sweenys hammond organ and the entire track find a deeper smoother soul groove atop scott esbecks bass line barfield also revisits his lover prison slowing slightly and adding more bottom end it end sounding like a winning cross the buckaroo and the lovin spoonfulthe album unusual cover a take on goffin king take a giant step that meld the psychedelic inflection of the monkees original the bside of first single with the slow tempo of taj mahals cover barfield and gozalezs original written separately and together include southernfunk dance number country rock and most winningly countrysoul tune that include the gonzalezsung still feel the feeling and the cowritten love gon na make it barfields texas sensibility fit well with the memphis influence gonzalez picked up working with dan penn and both fold perfectly the duo country root backed by a band thats equally home with twang and deep bass the stone river boy are set to burn it up on the road hyperbolium dot com

quadrophenia running the best album ever consider definitively in the top three along tommy who next i really like reissue the sound is good in opinion quite reviewer complaining it is faithful the original pete townsend liner note to this reissue explain that wanted to get back to the master and deal with the limitation of early recording technology to bring the music the way it intended to pete townsend wa the creative force behind the who who better to oversee a reissue i like the way that the individual instrument brought out in the new mix i the original vinyl lp and feel that this reissue improves the clarity of the instrument and vocal in addition to the improved sound get of the artwork and essay that townsend wrote for the quadrophenia album and a new essay the project finally you get several demo that pete worked for release all in all i think this reissue is a treat for who fan and a nice reintroduction to the classic quadrophenia album

drop the bomb on em sound like an outtake fromthe eminem show which is not a bad thing at all out of eminems solo track it probably the strongest of the five track it definitely the furthest in style from relapse eminems intention of supplying fan with these seven song to hold them over the next album wa a nice gesture but he shouldve released them a an ep rather than repackaging it with an album throwing mus dissolved back late ninety whimper a bang sure the band album limbo wa characteristically solid not quite to snuff with the rest esteemed catalog it failed to make a strong commercial showing the group quietly disbanded amidst financial trouble shortly the album wa released the time it seemed like one even noticed one of the best alternative rock group to arise of the eighty underground rock scene the mus undoubtedly deserved betterfortunately songwriterguitarist kristin hersh and company given a chance to write a new chapter in the band history throwing mus released last week the band old label ad reunites hersh with drummer dave narcizo and bassist bernard george and feature exbelly frontwomanformer mus guitarist tanya donnely on backing vocal marking first appearance on a mus record since the real ramonafrom the sound of it the mus eager to make up lost time throwing mus exhilarating ride manages to marry the helterskelter rhythmic pulse of the band first record with the poppier sensibility of their ninety release the opener quotmercuryquot is a bracing tune featuring lurching tempo and a typically intense vocal hersh after spending a few year making spare folky record sound ecstatic to have a rhythm section behind her and a rhythm section it is narcizo always one of alternative rock finest beatmasters reliably rocksteady but always finding new way around kit and throwing mus doesnt sound like the work of a band tying up loose end rather it sound like a new beginning quoti unshakenquot hersh proclaims on one track sounding like a defiant survivor someone ha made it darker time to emerge stronger everof course there still plenty of darkness lurking in the corner of hershs mind the grotto a solo album released simultaneously with throwing mus feature sparely recorded song are sure to unsettle even the toughest of listener imagine if sylvia plath turned to folk music rather than poetry and youll have some idea of the mood of album backed only her acoustic guitar and some almost superfluous keyboard and percussion the grotto isnt the type of record that win hersh many new admirer but it will send longtime fan fit of ecstasytyler wilcoxjunkmediaorg review

quotmardraumquot enslaved construct monumental dense tower blistering riff drench distortion asymmetric edifice crop atmospheric almost folky interlude maintain viking theme that run band earlier album dissonant chord and fuzzy noise cluster contribute peculiar atmosphere that set this album apart quotfrostquot and the like the hyperspeed guitar work continues to display the black metalderived shifting wall of melody n noise tempered angular thrashyproggy design that weave atypical stitching through the dense fabric of sound this album a bit polished earlier work is a good and bad thing on the one hand the unique dissonant riff and rhythm audibly distinct from the sound a whole on the hand a more obscure production job might better the overall atmosphere and made easier to focus on the cumulative power of the band enslaved have never really been a black metal band complaining this album sounding quotblack enoughquot is more le pointless still these viking metal pioneer have always been remarkable in ability to use norwegian black metal structural principle with a more quotepicquot range of tone and this is still true to a certain extent there an unfingerable slickness that keep this album from earning that extra star from this fan of the raw and raucous

ive never heard david nail varied selection of music collection including country music sample provided album sounded good i figured i would give a trywhen i received the disc i put it in the dvd player i use listen to music cd started to listen to the album beginning to end least i intended to listen the way to the endthe first thing i noticed that the music wa loud i turned the volume far a i could and still hear it helped unfortunately half way i to turn it it wa giving a headachei came back to it a day later and realized the cause for the irritation examining the audio the disc i found that the music wa mixed at a very high level bringing the track data sound forge the waveform showed i wa hearing many time the audio wa close to clipped because it wa mixed at a high levelusing dbpoweramps tool i wa able to determine that in order for this disc to normalized in volume the track on this disc had to be reduced in volume anywhere db this time around track and a whopping db summer job day track this mean that the best track needed to be reduced in volume by db in order to be normalized in volume the album gain reading came to db to normalize the volume of this album a a whole which sadusing tool it is possible to bring down the energy level unfortunately it mean that the low sound be lost a the the entire track is reduced in volume to accomodate for the high average energy this serf to deaden the sound quality and mute nuance that might be in the musicits especially sad since the music sound pretty good similar to country music that is popular and i dont necessarily have anything bad to say about the quality of the artist work unfortunately bad choice made in the production of this disc and i hope that this wa a preproduction run sent out for review and that the full production run wa fixed it went on salewhat i find surprising is that none of the other review have mentioned the compressed dynamic of this disc this is the first time ive ever run into a disc that wa overdriven to this extent and the fact that others have noticed it baffle me either i have a bad disc or the current state of music quality is so bad that people accept this a normalfor information on this issue please do a search for dynamic range compression and it relates to broadcasting and music production action like this serve to degrade audio quality not enhance it and it not be tolerated by the buying publicas a result of the poor mixing done on this disc i can not recommend it giving it two star is a gift and only because the artist shouldnt be given i hate it rating for something wa probably not able to controlartistically the music is ok technically this disc is a mess and should never be sold to the general public i will be contacting the publisher to see is a corrected version available and i would be happy to revise this review if i find out that the problem is isolated to the preproduction run

wilhelm kempff considered one great beethoven pianist of the century title like bestowed upon is beyond comprehension kempff wa excellent pianist superb technique this recording of beethoven four famous piano sonata show however performance dry lack passion and leave the listener with a feeling of emptiness due to a lack of energy beethoven is a composer whose piece be played with passion and energy this recording is technically good it lack two important element make the work of beethoven great kempff play in a classical manner prof far mellow beethoven the tempo are ridiculously slow for example the presto portion of the appasionata is one of the sonata highlight of intensity kempff play it faster an allegreto and with little force sure youre a beginner to beethoven a piano student looking how to play piece this recording is perfect for a good introduction or learning tool to those however looking for great beethoven performance that are fiery and impassioned this recording is suggested too mild for my taste and im quite sure if you hear it you agree buy if youre a beginner or really want version of these sonata in collection this record should otherwise be passed

metal music fan past year ive seen fair share band come go ive also seen my share of undeserving band get notoriety and undue popularity malevolent creation though fall a different category band put every ounce of talent and energy and reap well deserved acclaim quotretributionquot the band nd cd absolutely one of the top death metal album ever producedwhat make record stand the rest of the heap is the absolutely murderous intention exhibited playing a ferocity and fire rarely achieved the death metal genre the malevolent one go a rampage of technically proficient razor sharp death annihilating doesnt justice a a descriptionkicking thing with a reworking of the theme quothenry portrait of a serial killerquot quoteve of the apocalypsequot open and just shred ear prototypical malevolent creation with plenty of stop and go riffage unbelievably brutalizing drumming from the disappeared alex marquez and in my opinion the best death metal vocalist ive heard brett hoffman not hoffman not do annoying gurgling vomit vocal ie cannibal corpse suffocation give a unique individual and account terrifying vocal performance listen the shriek scream and howl on quotthe coldest survivequot quotslaughter of innocencequot and quotmindlockquot this is a death metal vocalist vocalize coupled together with the murderous composition herethis make for a seriously damaging listeningi know might have gone a bit far with the praise in this review for never another band like prime time malevolent creation forget the followup quotstillbornquot a is a horrible cd in a field immitation is not only commonplace it is expected this band stamped out identity and made impact not felt since death metal reared head a a genre this might arguably be death metal answer to quotreign in bloodquot this is the one cd that cost is absolutely worth every penny spent on it

youre gon na get it if you were hoping for of the youre gon na get that and mean of thing in the best possible way justins guitar playing remains hypnotic a drone pushed to the background layer vocal track vocal track multitracked wonder of harmony and if not dissonance then perhaps near harmony are a big part of what make special he us full range including a interesting falsetto throughout of his song creating insular and fascinating sound world lyric float in and of the haze struggling to understood the word are important not important a the raw feeling that you get from the soundsthe title track is the one that a lot of folk have heardit is beautiful and perhaps the similar to the first album but from thing start to grow and change baby feature a repeated piano figure instead of a guitar drone and it is definitely a little bit of a surprise but a always the bleakness and grandiosity both somehow get to you how so much music fit so little tune yet this music is not without melodymelody reveals slowly much like the pleasure of listening to this discthe final song entitled wood is a sidetrip for u a best a i can figure i doubt that this be the way that bon iver composes climbing a snake twisting and stretching revealing subtle beauty in bizarrely shifting howling chord it brings imogen heap if were a wild werewolf to mind but really is a thing unto itself haunting john lennon imagine album begin high point the beautifully performed imagine everyone opinion interpretation the song attitude towards change with my mood it great song regardless of my mood one thing is sure however and is that the title track is a different song the rest of the album jealous guy oh my love and oh yoko good love song or even fear of love song with song least us of the poetic language that made many of his song so universal scope however the track crippled inside could a good way describe the rest of the album it is also indication that album is going to be a musical adventure but a physiological enema set to music in many way this album is the bravest ever made it seems that every feeling john ha the past month since the breakup of the beatles is shared with u in a raw and direct a way a possible this is the strength and weakness of the rest of the album it ha strength in directness but weak in the poetic language that made the title track so appealing the rest of the album is painful that not mean it is bad i mean is that the rest of the song are full of pain irrational crippling pain the painful of is of course do sleep with it direct merciless attack his old bandmate an attack may brought some satisfaction to lennon but it make his listener question how dedicated he to joining u and the world be a one yet even this is part of this emotional unveiling a he is not even afraid to let u see his own inner contradiction this would probably have a better album he had made it of a set of song and le a set of diary page but all the risk he take on this album it at least deserves four star in short i like the album but i dont love it
